Type-3, 0.9mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), For DDR5 SODIMM and LPDDR5/x CAMM2

Pcb Type: Type-3

Pcb Thickness: 0.9mm

Pcb Layer Count: 10

Category: Mainstream

Material: Premium Mid Loss (PML)

Variant: For DDR5 SODIMM and LPDDR5/x CAMM2

Type-3, 0.9mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), For DDR5 SODIMM and LPDDR5/x CAMM2

S/MNoneS/MNone1340.031
Notes
Note
Dielectric thickness of 64um has been chosen specifically on SL layers to ensure POR memory speeds are met. Customers following thicker dielectrics will need to ensure cross talk co-efficients are equal to or less than those specified in memory Tline spec

M*MS1, 10TCP TBT5 (Post-Channel)13512580080080-0.81-0.070.04
M*MS1, 10HDMI (Post-Channel)95200500500100-0.810.20.16
Type-3, 0.9mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) Tline Spec (Differential) Notes
Note
Routing Notes for CSI CPHY: (1) CPHY must be routed as a trio (2) If the port is supposed to support both CPHY and DPHY, it must be routed following CPHY guidelines (3) CPHY impedance target is 40 ohms single ended and 80 ohms differential (4) All traces in trio must follow same trace width (5) Intra-Pair guidelines must be used for trace to trace spacing in a trio (6) S-ES guidelines must be used for trio to trio in the same port (7) S-Non-ES must be used for port to port or CPHY to other interface
CNVIo3 to non-CNVIo3 pair spacing of 10H (H=Dielectric Thickness) is required. If cannot be achieved then GND shielding with proper stitching vias and 3H minimum spacing from GND shielding to CNVIo3 is required.
TCP TBT5, TCP DP and eDP AUX signals: If needed, B* MS S-ES(um)=250, S-Non-ES(um)=375 or greater, B* SL/DSL S-ES(um)=88, S-Non-ES(um)=300 or greater and M* MS/SL/DSL S-ES(um)/S-Non-ES(um)=300 or greater.
For DMI Gen5 M* MS routing, S-ES(um) can be relaxed to 500.

M*DSL5, 6Imaging Clock, SUSCLK12037537540-0.210.130.13
M*DSL5, 6CLINK, I3C, SPI0 Flash12025037540-0.210.640.13
M*DSL5, 6XTAL, RTC120200177540-0.211.210.01
Type-3, 0.9mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) Tline Spec (Single Ended) Notes
Note
Based on Tline Spec (Single Ended) table recommendation, the CLK - Any (um) spacing requirement shall be applicable for; 1) CLK to DATA signals on similar signaling group 2) CLK to DATA and CLK signals from other signaling group For CLK to non-toggling signals, the spacing between the CLK to others can be relaxed and used the DATA - Any (um) spacing requirement. Please refer to "TBD_PTL_UH_Proc_Line_BGA_Pkg_Ballout_Mech_Spec_Revxpx.xlsx" on the Pinlist for non-toggling signals.

DDR5

Interface: DDR5

Notes

Type-3, 0.9mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) DDR5 Notes
Note
RCOMP to other nets spacing requirement is minimum 400um.
DDR to Non-DDR nets spacing requirement is minimum 500um.
DRAM RESET to be routed with 40ohms impedance on Layer1,Layer 3, Layer 5, Layer 7, Layer 10 and distance to other nets (spacing requirement) is minimum 300um
Route RCOMP with 75um TW (MR) in Layer 1/10. GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip. GND reference required.
ALERT to other nets spacing requirement is minimum 400um.

LPDDR5/x

Interface: LPDDR5/x

Notes

Type-3, 0.9mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) LPDDR5/x Notes
Note
RCOMP to other nets spacing requirement is minimum 400um.
DDR to Non-DDR nets spacing requirement is minimum 500um.
DRAM RESET to be routed with 40ohms impedance on Layer1,Layer 3 and Layer 5 and distance to other nets (spacing requirement) is minimum 250um
Route RCOMP with 75um TW (MR) in Layer 1,10. GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip. GND reference required.

S/MNoneS/MNone1340.031
Notes
Note
Thinner dielectric thickness has been chosen specifically on SL layers to ensure POR memory speeds can be met for DQ/DQS/WCK signals. Customers following thicker dielectrics from POR stack-up will need to ensure cross talk co-efficient are equal to or less than those specified in memory Tline spec.

M*SL6CPU PCIe Gen4, CPU PCIe Gen5, DMI Gen5, PCH PCIe Gen1-4, PCH PCIe Gen58012037550080-0.780.010.001
M*SL6CNVIO3, TCP DP, TCP TBT58012037537580-0.780.010.01
M*SL6CPU USB3.2 Gen1, CPU USB3.2 Gen2, PCH USB3.2 Gen1, PCH USB3.2 Gen2, TCP USB3.28012045050080-0.780.0020.001
M*SL6CSI CPHY8517017050080-0.770.430.001
Type-4 2-x-2+, 0.8mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) Tline Spec (Differential) Notes
Note
Routing Notes for CSI CPHY: (1) CPHY must be routed as a trio (2) If the port is supposed to support both CPHY and DPHY, it must be routed following CPHY guidelines (3) CPHY impedance target is 40 ohms single ended and 80 ohms differential (4) All traces in trio must follow same trace width (5) Intra-Pair guidelines must be used for trace to trace spacing in a trio (6) S-ES guidelines must be used for trio to trio in the same port (7) S-Non-ES must be used for port to port or CPHY to other interface
CNVIo3 to non-CNVIo3 pair spacing of 10H (H=Dielectric Thickness) is required. If cannot be achieved then GND shielding with proper stitching vias and 3H minimum spacing from GND shielding to CNVIo3 is required.
TCP TBT5, TCP DP and eDP AUX signals: If needed, B* MS S-ES(um)=250, S-Non-ES(um)=375 or greater, B* SL/DSL S-ES(um)=88, S-Non-ES(um)=300 or greater and M* MS/SL/DSL S-ES(um)/S-Non-ES(um)=300 or greater.
For DMI Gen5 M* MS routing, S-ES(um) can be relaxed to 500.

LPDDR5/x

Interface: LPDDR5/x

Notes

Type-4 2-x-2+, 0.8mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) LPDDR5/x Notes
Note
RCOMP to other nets spacing requirement is minimum 400um.
DDR to Non-DDR nets spacing requirement is minimum 500um.
DRAM RESET to be routed with 40 ohm impedance on L1, L2 & L4 and the spacing requirement is minimum 250um from other nets.
Route RCOMP with 75um TW (MR) in Layer 1,10. GND shield to any high speed IO with VSS trace/ strip. GND reference required.

CNVIO3

Description: Serial Time Encoded Protocol (STEP) is a non-NRZ, non-PAM signaling architecture, which is referred to as CNVIO3 in product design guidelines. CNVIO3 (STEP) uses pulse width modulation and operates at a lower fundamental frequency than NRZ for similar data rates. It is a DC coupled asynchronous bus having high bandwidth, low power and small exit latency from low power states. The current version of CNVIO3 has a data transfer rate of 12gbps to support the Intel WIFI7 integrated solution. CNVIO3 runs over same traces as CNVIO2 clock lanes (1 Tx clock and 1 Rx Clock). CNVIO3 along with rest of CNVIO2 interface operates as combo solution, allowing customers to use legacy WIFI6 products, or new WIFI7 modules. Reflections and crosstalk are the primary performance limiters and hence CNVIO3 requires a very clean channels.

Module Down Pad Dimension and Voiding Requirements
M.2 Connector Pad Voiding Recommendation
CNVio Breakout and Break-in Guideline
CNVIO3 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupVoid reference plane for all component pads such as AC cap, connector and module pads to optimize the impedance matching in the channel. Recommended voiding depth: -For M.2 connector pads: >= 230 um to the closest ground reference layer -For module pads: >= 150 um to the closet ground reference layer
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to use 0402 or smaller component sizes.
Number of vias allowed 2
Max via stub length for Type 3 PTH Vias215um
Maximum via stub for Type 4 Buried PTH Via85um
Reference planeContinuous GND is recommended.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
CNVio BO/BI routing guideBreak-in/Break-out (BI) at the device requires the same impedance as main route. No neckdown into pin field. Refer to “CNVio BI/BO at Device Guideline” for more details.
Module pad dimensionModule pad dimension is 0.4mm x 0.6mm. Refer to the “Module Down Pad Dimension and Voiding Requirements” diagram.
Essential guidelines for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSDo not route CNVio3 traces on any layer of the PCB under phase nodes, Inductor and DrMOS.
CNVio3 pair to Non-CNVio3 pair spacing guidelineCNVIo3 to non-CNVIo3 pair spacing of 10H (H=Dielectric Thickness) is required. If cannot be achieved then GND shielding with proper stitching vias and 3H minimum spacing from GND shielding to CNVIo3 is required.
CNVIO3 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.178
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)Yes0

Maximum via stub allowed for Type 4 Buried PTH via85um
M.2 Connector pin 18M.2 connector pin 18 is highly recommended to be Grounded so as to avoid common mode noise coupling from BRI and other single ended signals impacting CNVio3 signal quality.

CSI CPHY

CPHY_cable_guidelines
CSI CPHY General Guidelines
NoteDetail
CPHY configuration routing recommendation Recommend each CPHY port to be routed on the same layer.
Common mode choke (CMC)Need is platform/ sensor specific and should be located near sensor. CMC not accounted for in PDG.
Trio length matching125 um for each trio; 1 mm between trios of a port
Trio routing arrangementAll trios should be routed as A-B-C or C-B-A
Referencing considerationNo routing over split planes allowed, or routing over noisy power planes. Only routing over solid planes are permissible. MIPI CSI CPHY signals should be treated as single ended nets.
Via placementVia placement must be uniform within a trio to enable unform routing and transition. During each via transition, it is imperative that return vias are placed symmetrically close to the data vias. Ensure minimal routing imbalances when traces are routed in/out from the via to reduce impedance imbalance i.e uniformity of spacing between wire A,B and C.
CSI port use preferenceIf some of the CSI ports are not used, it must have CSI_A as one of the used ports.
Loss numbers 1. PCB Loss number assumed: -0.42dB/inch (worst case) at 1.25 GHz 2. FPC cable loss number assumed: -0.316dB/inch (worst case) at 1.25 GHz 3. Cable length guideline is based on FPC cable. FPC cable loss should be within the loss number specified above. If micro-Coax is used, cable length can be longer as micro-Coax loss. Ex. 40 AWG cable has loss: -0.15dB/inch at 1.25 GHz. Please note that Cable loss numbers are general guidelines and actual numbers may be different due to the dimensions, type of material used. (Refer to the individual topologies for total loss numbers). These loss number take precedence over length mentioned in individual topologies below specially while using lower loss cable options like micro coaxial cables.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Cable assembly impedance50 ohms +/- 10% for single ended
Cable assembly Insertion Loss> -0.72 dB/inch; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable assembly Return Loss< -28 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable assembly Near end Crosstalk< -25 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable assembly Far end Crosstalk< -26 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable only impedance50 ohms +/- 10% for single ended
Cable only Insertion Loss> -0.041 dB/inch; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable only Return Loss< -50 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable only Near end Crosstalk< -55 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable only Far end Crosstalk< -63 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz

4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No

NoteDetail
Reference plane for microstrip routeFull Ground reference
Reference plane for stripline routeBoth sides can either be continuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Total insertion loss (BO+M1+M2+Cable)For ≤ 1.0 Gsps: up to -10 dB @1.25 GHz.

CSI DPHY

CSI DPHY General Guidelines
NoteDetail
DPHY configuration routing recommendation Recommend each DPHY configuration (example: X4) to be routed on the same layer.
Common mode choke (CMC)Need is platform/ sensor specific and should be located near sensor. CMC not accounted for in PDG.
Port connectivityIt is recommended that CSI A be one of the used ports if all ports are not used.
Loss numbers1. PCB Loss number assumed: -0.36dB/inch (worst case) at 1.25 GHz 2. FPC cable loss number assumed: -0.316dB/inch (worst case) at 1.25 GHz 3. Cable length guideline is based on FPC cable. FPC cable loss should be within the loss number specified above. If micro-Coax is used, cable length can be longer as micro-Coax loss. Ex. 40 AWG cable has loss: -0.15dB/inch at 1.25 GHz. Please note that Cable loss numbers are general guidelines and actual numbers may be different due to the dimensions, type of material used. (Refer to the individual topologies for total loss numbers). These loss number take precedence over length mentioned in individual topologies below specially while using lower loss cable options like micro coaxial cables.
CSI DPHY Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)Yes1

CSI DPHY Main Link Up To 1.0 Gbps Topology

CSI DPHY Main Link Up To 1.0 Gbps Topology Diagram
CSI DPHY Main Link Up To 1.0 Gbps Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane for microstrip routeContinuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Reference plane for stripline and dual stripline routeBoth sides can either be continuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
510 mm cable assemblyRecommend 100 Ω +/- 10% including tolerances. Return loss < -15 dB @ ≤ 1.25 GHz. Crosstalk < -50 dB @ ≤ 1.25 GHz.
Total insertion loss (BO+M1+M2+Cable)For ≤ 1.0 Gbps: up to -10 dB @1.25 GHz.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx2Total Channel

CSI DPHY Main Link Up To 1.5 Gbps Topology

CSI DPHY Main Link Up To 1.5 Gbps Topology Diagram
CSI DPHY Main Link Up To 1.5 Gbps Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane for microstrip routeContinuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Reference plane for stripline and dual stripline routeBoth sides can either be continuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
305 mm cable assemblyRecommend 100 Ω +/- 10% including tolerances. Return loss < -15 dB @ ≤ 1.25 GHz. Crosstalk < -50 dB @ ≤ 1.25 GHz.
Total insertion loss (BO+M1+M2+Cable)For ≤ 1.5 Gbps: up to -7 dB @ 1.25 GHz.
Solution boundaryLength limited by DPHY v1.1 sensors that do not support skew calibration.

CPU PCIe Gen4

Recommended GND Stitching Via Placement
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation SMT footprint Voiding Reference
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation AC Cap Voiding
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Voiding Recommendation
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Toe and Heel GND Via Recommendation
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe Side HSIO Routing
CPU PCIe Gen4 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads reference plane for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe4 AC capacitor size for mainstream stackupIt is required to use 0402 or smaller component sizes. If routing near maximum length it is recommended to use 0201 component size.
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Maximum via stub length 250 um
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential Oval Anti Pad required for all layers. For PCIe4, see topology specific notes for additional guidance.
Voiding under CEM SMT connector padsRequired
Fiberweave for PCIe4Must adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
PCIe4 redriverRouting length can be extended beyond the PDG guidelines by using redriver. Refer to document #575423 for further details.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, only a single continuous power reference plane is permitted on one side, but the other side must be a continuous ground. Simulation is needed to ensure electrical requirements are met.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, only a single continuous power reference plane is permitted on one side, but the other side must be a continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Simulation is needed to ensure electrical requirements are met.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
0 Ohm resistor for PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe30402 or smaller size . Component pads need to be voided.
Backdrill for PCB PTHSignals can transition between any PCB layers as long as the maximum via / PTH stub length is < 250 um. Use backdrill to reduce stub length to meet < 250 um requirement.
CPU PCIe Gen4 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um
AC cap valueRefer to Base Spec
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

PCIe Gen4 M.2 Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Add-in Card ConnectorConnector type: M.2 1. Each M.2 connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5mm max.
Add-in Card DevicePCIe Gen4 M.2 Spec compliant add-in card device.
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um
AC cap valueRefer to Base Spec
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Notes

Backdrilled viaAllow for exit backdrill via of 250 um with 180 um entry stub.

(Internal) PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Topology

PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Topology Diagram
PCIe4 CEM Connector Sideband Optimization
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Connector Voiding
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 1
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 2
PCIe Gen 4 CEM Connector Antipad Optimization
PCIe Board Layout Recommendation_ SMT Footprint Voiding Reference
PCIe Board Layout Recommendation_ Toe Side HSIO Routing
(Internal) PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF. (Spec range 176 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
CEM connector Vss pad to via distanceEach CEM connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5mm max.
Add-in cardAssuming ~76 mm of PCB routing and 2 vias with spec reference package. The total length matching RX-RX/TX-TX lane to lane (25mm max) include the budget within the module.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Notes
NoteDetail
Backdrilled viaAllow for exit backdrill via of 250 um with 180 um entry stub.

NoteDetail
FFC CableAssume FFC Cable up to 20 inches length or Insertion loss of 4.65 dB @ 8 GHz
MB and Daughter Card StackupAssume both Main Board and the Daughter Card is the same stack up.
Maximum via stub length250 um
Device AIC Assume Max Length of Device AIC is < 3 inches and meeting PCIE4 spec reference package requirements.

CPU PCIe Gen5

PCIE5 Board Layout Recommendation AC Cap Voiding
CPU PCIe Gen5 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe5 AC capacitor sizeIt is required to use 0201 . Void reference layer under pad size of differential cap together. Extend void by 38 um on all sides of pads. Reference example provided per figure. Ensure spacing between P and N cap is about 305 um and spacing between caps of different pair caps is more than 762 um.
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Interleaved requirementRefer to topology section for details.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential Oval Anti Pad required for all layers. For PCIe5, see topology specific notes for additional guidance.
Voiding under CEM SMT connector padsRequired
Fiberweave for PCIe5Must adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, only a single continuous power reference plane is permitted on one side, but the other side must be a continuous ground. Simulation is needed to ensure electrical requirements are met.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, only a single continuous power reference plane is permitted on one side, but the other side must be a continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Simulation is needed to ensure electrical requirements are met.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Backdrill for PCB PTHSignals can transition between any PCB layers as long as the maximum via / PTH stub length is < 250 um. Use backdrill to reduce stub length to meet < 250 um requirement.
CPU PCIe Gen5 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.125
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

NoteDetail

AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended (spec range 176 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Add-in card connector (CEM)Only SMT is supported.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Connector requirementThis topology assumes connector insertion loss is < 0.52 dB, FEXT better than -44 dB and NEXT better than -44 dB up to Nyquist.

PCH PCIe Gen1-4

Recommended GND Stitching Via Placement
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation SMT footprint Voiding Reference
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation AC Cap Voiding
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Voiding Recommendation
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Toe and Heel GND Via Recommendation
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe Side HSIO Routing
PCH PCIe Gen1-4 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (3) If non-continuous power referencing is unavoidable on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 discrete component part size for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to use 0402 or smaller component sizes.
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Interleave requirementRefer to topology section for details.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 max via stub length< 900 um
PCIe4 max via stub length< 250 um
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential Oval Anti Pad required for all layers.
Voiding under CEM SMT connector padsRequired
PCIe4 RedriverRouting length can be extended beyond the PDG guidelines by using redriver. Refer to document #575423 for further details.
Fiberweave for PCIe4Must adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926)
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
0 Ohm resistor for PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe30402 or smaller size . Component pads reference plane needs to be voided.
Backdrill for PCB PTHSignals can transition between any PCB layers as long as the maximum via / PTH stub length is < 250 um. Use backdrill to reduce stub length to meet < 250 um requirement.
PCH PCIe Gen1-4 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

(Internal) PCIe Gen1 Add-in Card Topology

PCIe Gen1 Add-in Card Topology Diagram
(Internal) PCIe Gen1 Add-in Card Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Add-in card (M4 + M5)The total length of the add-in card (M4 + M5) is usually 38 mm to 50.4 mm. The M4 + M5 segment is a combination of MS/SL/DSL (MS where required to connect to surface mounted components). The M4 + M5 segment has a typical via count of 1.
Reference planecontinuous GND recommended. See Power Referencing tab for power referencing guidelines
Recommended AC capacitor value for PCIe Gen1Nominal 220 nF. (Spec range 176 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Max via stub length900 um
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedNotes
Rx, Tx4PCIe Gen1 Motherboard
Rx, Tx1Express card / Add-in card

Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx

Category: Mainstream

Material: Premium Mid Loss (PML)

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: None

(Internal) PCIe Gen1 Add-in Card Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL12.7

(Internal) PCIe Gen2 Add-in Card Topology

PCIe Gen2 Add-in Card Topology Diagram
(Internal) PCIe Gen2 Add-in Card Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Add-in card (M4 + M5)The total length of the add-in card (M4 + M5) is usually 38 mm to 50.4 mm. The M4 + M5 segment is a combination of MS/SL/DSL (MS where required to connect to surface mounted components). The M4 + M5 segment has a typical via count of 1.
Reference planeContinuous GND recommended. See Power Referencing tab for power referencing guidelines
Recommended AC capacitor value for PCIe Gen2Nominal 220 nF. (Spec range 176 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Maximum via stub length900 um
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedNotes

NoteDetail
Add-in card (M4 + M5)The total length of the add-in card (M4 + M5) is usually 38mm to 50.4mm. The M4 + M5 segment is a combination of MS/SL/DSL (MS where required to connect to surface mounted components). The M4 + M5 segment has a typical via count of 1.
Reference planeContinuous GND recommended. See Power Referencing tab for power referencing guidelines
Recommended AC Capacitor value for PCIE Gen 3Nominal 220 nF. (Spec range 176 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Maximum Via Stub Length900 um
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

(Internal) PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Topology

PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Topology Diagram
PCIe4 CEM Connector Sideband Optimization
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Connector Voiding
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 1
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 2
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation SMT footprint Voiding Reference
PCIe Gen 4 CEM Connector Antipad Optimization
PCIe Board Layout Recommendation_ Toe Side HSIO Routing
(Internal) PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Add-in card (M4 + M5)The total length of the add-in card (M4 + M5) is usually 38 mm to 50.4 mm. The M4 + M5 segment is a combination of MS/ SL/ DSL (MS where required to connect to surface mounted components). The M4 + M5 segment has a typical via count of 1. The total length matching RX-RX/TX-TX lane to lane (25mm max) include the budget within the module.
AC capacitor valueNominal 220 nF. (Spec range 176 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Maximum via stub length250 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
Add-in card connector (CEM)Bottom entry to PCIe slot with no stub length (not counted in max vias allowed).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedNotes
Rx, Tx2PCIe Gen4 (not counting via under package)

Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx

Category: Mainstream

Material: Premium Mid Loss (PML)

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: None

(Internal) PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL12.7
M1 + M2MS, DSL, SLBO+M1+M2+M3 <= 127 mm
M3MS, DSL, SL8

Max Length Total (mm): 127

PCIe Gen4 Device Down Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen4 Device Down Topology Notes
NoteDetail
DevicePCIe Gen4 Spec compliant device.
AC cap valueRefer to Base Spec
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

PCIe Gen4 M.2 Topology

PCIe Gen4 M.2 Topology Diagram
Suggested Toe and Heel Side Connection
Suggested Ground Void for Main Board M.2 Connector
PCIe Gen4 M.2 Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Add-in Card ConnectorConnector type: M.2 1. Each M.2 connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5mm max.
Add-in Card DevicePCIe Gen4 M.2 Spec compliant add-in card device.
AC cap valueRefer to Base Spec
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
Notes
NoteDetail
Backdrilled viaAllow for exit backdrill via of 250 um with 180 um entry stub.

PCH PCIe Gen5

PCIE5 Board Layout Recommendation AC Cap Voiding
PCH PCIe Gen5 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe5 AC capacitor sizeIt is required to use 0201 . Void reference layer under pad size of differential cap together. Extend void by 38 um on all sides of pads. Reference example provided per figure. Ensure spacing between P and N cap is about 305 um and spacing between caps of different pair caps is more than 762 um.
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Interleaved requirementRefer to topology section for details.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential Oval Anti Pad required for all layers. For PCIe5, see topology specific notes for additional guidance.
Voiding under CEM SMT connector padsRequired
Fiberweave for PCIe5Must adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Backdrill for PCB PTHSignals can transition between any PCB layers as long as the maximum via / PTH stub length is < 250 um. Use backdrill to reduce stub length to meet < 250 um requirement.
PCH PCIe Gen5 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.125
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

PCIe Gen5 Device Down Topology

PCIe Gen5 Device Down Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen5 Device Down Topology Notes
NoteDetail
DevicePCIe Gen5 Spec compliant device.
AC cap valueRefer to Base Spec
Maximum via stub length250 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Additional simulations might be required to quantify impact of dual referencing. Multiple split planes on reference layers is not recommended.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Additional simulations might be required to quantify impact of dual referencing. Multiple split planes on reference layers is not recommended.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedNotes
Rx, Tx4PCIe Gen5

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
TXDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
CAPCapacitor34
M2Trace45
BITrace56
DeviceDevice6-1

Signal Group: Rx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
RXDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
CAPCapacitor34
M2Trace45
BITrace56
DeviceDevice6-1

PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology

PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen5 M.2 Connector Voiding Recommendation
Suggested Toe and Heel Side Connection
PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Add-in Card ConnectorConnector type: M.2 1. Each M.2 connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 255 um max. 2. Toe-side routing only for SMT connector.
Add-in Card DevicePCIe Gen5 M.2 Spec compliant add-in card device.
AC cap valueRefer to Base Spec
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Additional simulations might be required to quantify impact of dual referencing. Multiple split planes on reference layers is not recommended.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedNotes

(internal) PCIe Gen5 Add-in Card Topology

PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Connector Voiding
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 1
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 2
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe Side HSIO Routing
PCIe Board Layout Recommendation_ SMT Footprint Voiding Reference
(internal) PCIe Gen5 Add-in Card Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length250 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended (spec range 176 nF to 265 nF including tolerance.). Use 0201 component size.
Add-in card connector (CEM)Only SMT is supported.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Connector requirementThis topology assumes connector insertion loss is < 0.52 dB, FEXT better than -44 dB and NEXT better than -44 dB up to Nyquist.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedNotes

(Internal) PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology (Operating at Gen4 Data Rate)

PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology (Operating at Gen4 Data Rate) Diagram
PCIe Gen5 M.2 Connector Voiding Recommendation
Suggested Toe and Heel Side Connection
(Internal) PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology (Operating at Gen4 Data Rate) Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended (spec range 176 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Routing typeMain route routing must be interleaved.
M.2 connector1. Each M.2 connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 255 um max. 2. Toe-side routing only for SMT connector.
Add-in cardAssuming ~50 mm of PCB routing and 2 vias with spec reference package. The total length matching RX-RX/TX-TX lane to lane (25mm max) include the budget within the module.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias Allowed
Rx, Tx2

DMI Gen5

DMI Gen5 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads reference plane for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, only a single continuous power reference plane is permitted on one side, but the other side must be a continuous ground. Simulation is needed to ensure electrical requirements are met.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, only a single continuous power reference plane is permitted on one side, but the other side must be a continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Simulation is needed to ensure electrical requirements are met.
DMI Gen5 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

TCP DP

TCP DP General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendationIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel. Voiding of 0402 or smaller AC capacitors pads is not necessary.
DISP_UTILSRecommend 50 Ohm nominal trace impedance with reasonable noise isolation. Requires level shifter on the platform.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
TCP DP Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25

TCP DP UHBR20 Retimer MUX With Barlow Ridge Topology

TCP DP UHBR20 Retimer MUX With Barlow Ridge Topology Diagram
TCP DP UHBR20 Retimer MUX With Barlow Ridge Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length250 um per via
Routing styleTo reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
AC cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Supported interfacesDP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Retimer MUXRetimer MUX RX must be compliant to VESA DisplayPort (DP) Standard version 2.1.
Barlow Ridge routing guidelinesRefer to RDC #736855 for Barlow Ridge guidelines.

TCP DP UHBR20 Retimer MUX With Barlow Ridge Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Tx, Pre-Channel 2 Other Signals
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
M4+M5MS, DSL, SL0Note1*

DP_PWR Pin Back Drive Protection Circuit

DP_PWR Pin Back Drive Protection Circuit Diagram
DP_PWR Pin Back Drive Protection Circuit Notes
NoteDetail
Non-compliant DP cablesDP_PWR pin 20 of DP connector provides power to the connected dongle from the platform (source) and monitor (sink). As per specification, normal DP to DP monitor cable assembly should not connect this across the cable. Non-compliant cables in the market have them as direct connection. This results in Display monitor back driving current to the motherboard and causing system malfunction during power on or when waking-up from sleep state.
Back drive preventionAdd a back driver protection circuit (FET) as shown above on the DP_PWR pin 20 of the DP connector. Select MOSFET with on resistance less than 0.35 Ohm to meet spec requirement of minimum 2.98 Volts at DP_PWR pin with 0.5 A current.
N-MOSFET gateConnect gate of n-MOSFET to a power supply which will turn off during sleep states and will guarantee that the MOSFET on resistance is > 0.35 Ohm , for example +V12S or +V5S.
AlternativesCustomer can have an alternate back drive protection circuit provided it can meet the minimum voltage requirement of 2.98 Volts considering a 3.3 Volts power supply design that also has some voltage tolerance (+/- 5%).

(Internal only) TCP DP UHBR20 Retimer MUX M.2 Modular Topology

TCP DP UHBR20 Retimer MUX M.2 Modular Topology Diagram
(Internal only) TCP DP UHBR20 Retimer MUX M.2 Modular Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length250 um per via between CPU and retimer. Retimer post-channel cannot have via stub.
Routing styleStripline strongly recommended to reduce RFI/ EMI. If microstrip routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
CMCFor recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section. Optional. Populating will not reduce the supported length.
ESDFor recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section.
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance.
RetimerRetimer MUX RX must be compliant to VESA DisplayPort (DP) Standard version 2.1.
Length from retimer to DP connectorSuperseded by retimer vendor recommendations.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Module InformationGuidelines compatible with: TCSS-401
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Tx2Pre-ChannelThis note defines the pre-channel as main board only.

TCP DP AUX Retimer MUX With Barlow Ridge Topology

TCP DP AUX Retimer MUX With Barlow Ridge Topology Diagram
TCP DP AUX Retimer MUX With Barlow Ridge Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedNo explicit limit, use best known routing practices.
Transmission line referencingReference planes can be continuous ground or continuous power that have low frequency peak to peak noise. Ground referencing is preferred.
ESD/ EOSPlease refer to Thunderbolt Retimer documentation for more details. Refer to RDC #736855 for Barlow Ridge guidelines.
Retimer MUXRetimer MUX must be compliant to VESA DisplayPort (DP) Standard version 2.1.
Cs cap value47 pF nominal.
Edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism such as a 47 pF capacitor (Cs) terminated to VSS is recommended. Cs cap is optional.
AC cap valueNominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 200 nF including tolerance).

HDMI

HDMI General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Length matching between pair to pair (inter pair)Within 13 mm (HDMI 2.1); 25 mm (HDMI 1.4).
Voiding recommendationIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel. Voiding of 0402 or smaller AC capacitors pads is not necessary.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left no connected at the BGA ball.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission lines should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
HDMI Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes13
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0

HDMI Limiting Redriver 12G Topology

HDMI Limiting Redriver 12G Topology Diagram
HDMI Limiting Redriver 12G Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length728 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeContinuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Reference plane for stripline and dual stripline routeBoth sides can either be continuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
CMCRefer Electromagnetic Compatibility Chapter (Common Mode Choke Selection) for more details. Populating will not reduce the supported length.
ESDConsult with the redriver vendor to determine the appropriate ESD recommendation. Optional: If Redriver has integrated ESD that meets discharge requirements.
AC cap value85 nF to 200 nF including tolerances.
Limiting RedriverRedriver must be HDMI 2.1a FRL spec compliant. Redriver part and equalization setting should be selected accordingly to compensate pre-channel losses. Refer to the redriver datasheet for detailed information on EQ settings and performance characteristics to achieve the best results. The exact pre-channel differential insertion loss for a given port with a specific routing and stackup can have a different maximum routing length limit. These recommendations are intended to ensure designs will have sufficient RX EQ to accommodate the expected worst-case loss.
Max supported HDMI 1.4b TMDS data rate3.4 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 TMDS data rate6.0 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 FRL data rate12 Gbps
Retimer sideband communicationAny port configured to support HDMI must implement sideband communications via the DDC (I2C) channel associated with that HDMI port as defined in the Video BIOS Table (VBT).
ConnectorConnector shall meet all Category 3 requirements defined by the HDMI1.4b spec (Pin assignment, contact sequence, mechanical performance, electrical performance, environmental characteristics, connector drawings) in addition to the electrical performance requirements listed in HDMI2.1 spec which are defined by compliance parametric electrical tests HFR6-1 (Mated Connector Differential Impedance), HFR6-2 (Mated Connector Attenuation - Differential Insertion Loss) and HFR6-3 (Mated Connector Attenuation to Far-End Crosstalk Ratio) and must be included within the “Approved Category 3 Connector list” defined by the HDMI Licensing Administrator Inc.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx2Pre-Channel

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
TXDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
M2Trace34
AC CAPCapacitor45
Limiting RedriverDevice56
M3Trace67
CMCDevice78
M4Trace89
ESDDevice910
M5Trace1011
HDMI ConnectorDevice11-1

Min Length Total Note: Refer to redriver vendor for minimum post-channel lengths.

Max Length Total Note: Note1*: Max/min routing length for HDMI Limiting Redriver 12G (12 Gbps) depends on redriver performance and its loss compensation capability when used in conjunction with Intel CPU. Work with redriver vendor to ensure the selected part can provide adequate signal integrity for the end device.

NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length728 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeContinuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Reference plane for stripline and dual stripline routeBoth sides can either be continuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
CMCRefer Electromagnetic Compatibility Chapter (Common Mode Choke Selection) for more details. Populating will not reduce the supported length.
ESDConsult with the redriver vendor to determine the appropriate ESD recommendation. Optional: If Redriver has integrated ESD that meets discharge requirements.
AC cap value85 nF to 200 nF including tolerances.
Limiting RedriverParade PS8219 Re-driver o equivalent ( Re-driver equalization should be selected accordantly to compensate pre-channel losses) Refer to the re-driver vendor datasheet for detailed information on EQ settings and performance characteristics to achieve the best results.
Max supported HDMI 1.4b TMDS data rate3.4 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 TMDS data rate6.0 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 FRL data rate12 Gbps
Retimer sideband communicationAny port configured to support HDMI must implement sideband communications via the DDC (I2C) channel associated with that HDMI port as defined in the Video BIOS Table (VBT).
ConnectorConnector shall meet all Category 3 requirements defined by the HDMI1.4b spec (Pin assignment, contact sequence, mechanical performance, electrical performance, environmental characteristics, connector drawings) in addition to the electrical performance requirements listed in HDMI2.1 spec which are defined by compliance parametric electrical tests HFR6-1 (Mated Connector Differential Impedance), HFR6-2 (Mated Connector Attenuation - Differential Insertion Loss) and HFR6-3 (Mated Connector Attenuation to Far-End Crosstalk Ratio) and must be included within the “Approved Category 3 Connector list” defined by the HDMI Licensing Administrator Inc.

(Internal) HDMI Limiting Redriver 12G Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Tx, Post-Channel Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
M3+M4+M5MS, DSL, SL25

Min Length Total Note: Refer to redriver vendor for minimum post-channel lengths.

Max Length Total (mm): 25

HDMI Retimer 12G Topology

HDMI Retimer 12G Topology Diagram
HDMI Retimer 12G Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length728 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeContinuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Reference plane for stripline and dual stripline routeBoth sides can either be continuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
CMCRefer Electromagnetic Compatibility Chapter (Common Mode Choke Selection) for more details. Populating will not reduce the supported length.
ESDPlease consult with the retimer vendor to determine the appropriate ESD recommendation. Optional: If Retimer has integrated ESD that meets discharge requirements.
AC cap value85 nF to 200 nF including tolerances.
RetimerRetimer Rx must be spec compliable for HDMI 2.1a FRL source requirements at TP2_EQ
Max supported HDMI 1.4b TMDS data rate3.4 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 TMDS data rate6.0 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 FRL data rate12 Gbps
Retimer sideband communicationAny port configured to support HDMI must implement sideband communications via the DDC (I2C) channel associated with that HDMI port as defined in the Video BIOS Table (VBT).
ConnectorConnector shall meet all Category 3 requirements defined by the HDMI1.4b spec (Pin assignment, contact sequence, mechanical performance, electrical performance, environmental characteristics, connector drawings) in addition to the electrical performance requirements listed in HDMI2.1 spec which are defined by compliance parametric electrical tests HFR6-1 (Mated Connector Differential Impedance), HFR6-2 (Mated Connector Attenuation - Differential Insertion Loss) and HFR6-3 (Mated Connector Attenuation to Far-End Crosstalk Ratio) and must be included within the “Approved Category 3 Connector list” defined by the HDMI Licensing Administrator Inc.

HDMI DDC Topology

HDMI DDC Topology Diagram
HDMI DDC Buffered Topology Diagram
HDMI DDC Topology Notes
NoteDetail
RoutingTotal length from driver to HDMI connector is limited by spec capacitance limit of 50 pF including trace capacitance and discrete. Please refer to I2C section for calculation details.
Power railsPower rails which will turn off in S3-S5 sleep states.
VCC-A1.8 V
VCC-B5 V
VCC-C3.3 V
U1 I2C Voltage Level Translator, TCA9509 or equivalent.
R1 resistor10 kΩ ± 5%
R2 resistor1.5 kΩ ± 5%
Back drive current protectionMax capacitance for back drive current protection Schottky diode is 10 pF. Must use diode of Schottky type to minimize voltage drop.
I2C guidanceDDC signals follow I2C guidelines.
Alternative implementations Depending on the Active Level Shifter implemented the DDC implementation may vary. Please refer to the vendors requirements for any changes in implementation.
Active level shifter partFollow Active Level Shifter datasheet recommendation as SDA/SCL signals may be optional depending on the part requirements. Component may be removed from the topology diagram if SDA/SCL connections are not required.
ESDRefer to Electromagnetic Compatibility chapter (ESD Diode Selection).
Cs cap value47 pF nominal.
Edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism such as a 47 pF capacitor (Cs) terminated to VSS is recommended to comply with DisplayPort maximum Aux slew rate specification .

NoteDetail
RoutingRecommend 45 Ohm nominal trace impedance with reasonable noise isolation.
VCC1.8 V
R1100 kΩ ±5%
R2100 kΩ ±5%
Q1BSS138p or equivalent, 0.85 V < VGS threshold < 1.95 V, input capacitance < 1 nF.
ConnectivityEnsure to follow the vendor data sheet for any additional HPD connectivity requirements.
ESDRefer to Electromagnetic Compatibility chapter (ESD Diode Selection).

eDP

eDP General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendationIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias, and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel. Voiding of 0402 or smaller AC capacitors pads is not necessary.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
eDP Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25

eDP HBR2 Main Link Topology Diagram
eDP HBR2 Main Link Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane for microstrip routeContinuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Reference plane for stripline and dual stripline routeBoth sides can either be continuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
CMCPlease refer to EMC Component Selection section for more details. Populating will not reduce the supported length.
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance.
355 mm cable assembly (micro coaxial)80-100 Ohm including tolerance. 25 mm assembly insertion loss ≥ -0.62 dB. 355 mm assembly insertion loss ≥ -5.1 dB @ 4.05 GHz.
Twisted pair cable assemblyRefer to "ADL_TwistedPair_CableSpec_eDP_TWP_Rev0p7" document #644925. This document describes the electrical parameter limits for the twisted pair cables assumed for this topology. It does not consider any EMI/ RFI risks.
TCON RX equalizationCTLE only.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

NoteDetail
Reference plane for microstrip routeContinuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.

AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance.
Mux component guidelinesUse a passive mux with the following parameters: Differential insertion loss @ 4.05 GHz > -2.2 dB Differential return loss @ 4.05 GHz < -8.0 dB Differential FEXT @ 4.05 GHz < -50 dB

SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL13
M1MS, DSL, SL210CTLE only assumed. This solution can be extended if DFE is applied. Contact SI owner if more solution is required.

Max Length Total (mm): 210

Max Length Total Note: Assuming TCSS 500 eDP Module. If another module is used, this recommendation must be revisted.

TCP TBT5

TCP TBT5 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Optimal routingFor optimal performance it is recommended to begin layout with TBT routing, use arc routing and maintain 3H spacing to vias/ void/ splits. It's also recommended that return loss specification of routing from retimer to Type-C connector is met. It is listed in section 5.5.1.1. of Type-C specification (Document #557111).
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackupRecommend 0201 components. It is OK to use 0402 component between CPU and retimer when NOT routing near maximum length. Strongly recommend 0201 components between retimer and Type-C connector, 0402 components may result in return loss spec violation.
Recommended short protection circuitIt is recommended to include this circuit to comply with USB ECN \"RX AC Coupling Capacitor Option\" to provide ESD/ EOS protection and set RX bias at the Type-C connector. See notes on each topology for Intel's recommendation on DC rating of the Crx. The customer should consider short event to VBUS that can be up to 25 V.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left unconnected at the BGA ball.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission lines should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to "Switching VR Circuit Guidelines" in the "General Design Considerations" section as well as Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
Dual-stripline routing recommendationDual-stripline routings refer to "General Dual-Stripline Support" section. When routing orthogonal or with angle on top of TBT5 DSL tlines, allow maximum of 3 aggressor pairs to route over 1 DSL routing victim pair.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
TCP0_dfx_dmonobs_n/p_lv[1:0]Do not include in external PDG. Route as 50 Ω single ended impedance traces. Provide good noise isolation (12 mil minimum). Connect to SMA/ SMP.
TCP0_dfx_amon_obs_lvDo not include in external PDG. Route as 50 Ω single ended impedance traces. Provide good noise isolation (12 mil minimum). Connect to SMA/ SMP.
TCP TBT5 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.125
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

TCP TBT5 Retimer Topology

TCP TBT5 Retimer Topology Diagram
TCP TBT5 Retimer Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
ESDPlease refer to Thunderbolt Retimer documentation for more details. Refer to RDC #843990 for June Bridge 80 Retimer guidelines.
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor 0201 required - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported For the pre-channel cap - Form factor 0201 recommended - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 required. - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5% Form factor: 0201.
Rc resistor value2.2 Ω - Form factor: 0201. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 Ω ± 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 Ω ± 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 Ω ± 5%.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerJune Bridge 80
CIO topology PlacementESD Diode, AC cap, Rb Resistor and Rc Resistor should be placed as close as possible to USBC connector up to 8mm radius
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector padsUp to 5.8dB @ 13GHz on PCB. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 5.0, Thunderbolt 4.0, USB4.0 Gen3, USB3.2 Gen2x2 and DP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Rx, Tx2Pre-ChannelMaximum via stub length of 250um.
Rx, Tx2Post-ChannelNo via stub allowed.

M2Trace34

M3Trace611
RcResistor1112

M4Trace1314

M5Trace1518

M2Trace34

M3Trace611

Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel

Category: Mainstream

Material: Premium Mid Loss (PML)

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: Pre-Channel

TCP TBT5 Retimer Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL2Minimize BO length to less than 2mm in the escape area near ball for Microstrip lines on Top or Bottom layer. Don't need to consider BO in the inner layer.
M1+M2MS, DSL, SL205DSL may cause via stub to be longer than the maximum required 250um. Via stub mitigation routing technique may be employed.

Max Length Total (mm): 205

Max Length Total Note: BO+M1+M2<=205mm. Max length can be increased up to 240 mm (BO+M1+M2), if more than 90% of the routed as stripline or dual-stripline.

TCP TBT5 Retimer with Internal Cable Topology

TCP TBT5 Retimer with Internal Cable Topology
TCP TBT5 Retimer with Internal Cable Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS main route routing is needed, 800µm spacing to equivalent signal (S-ES) is required between differential pairs. In cases where spacing to equivalent signal (S-ES) must be decreased due to breakout and break-in region routing constraints, ensure to gradually widen the spacing from 375um back to the standard 800µm to preserve signal integrity. Minimize length of section of routing that has less than 800um spacing. Refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
ESDPlease refer to Thunderbolt Retimer documentation for more details. Refer to RDC #843990 for June Bridge 80 Retimer guidelines.
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor 0201 required - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported For the pre-channel cap - Form factor 0201 recommended - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 required. - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5% Form factor: 0201
Rc resistor value2.2 Ω ± 10% Form factor: 0201. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 Ω ± 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 Ω ± 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 Ω ± 5%.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerJune Bridge 80
CIO topology PlacementESD Diode, AC cap, Rb Resistor and Rc Resistor should be placed as close as possible to USBC connector up to 8mm radius.
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector padsUp to 5.8dB @ 13GHz Ball to RCP pad (w/o connector). Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 5.0, Thunderbolt 4.0, USB4.0 Gen3, USB3.2 Gen2x2 and DP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Rx, Tx2Pre-ChannelMaximum via stub length 250um.
Rx, Tx2Post-ChannelNo via stub length allowed.

SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL2Minimize BO length to less than 2mm in the escape area near ball for Microstrip lines on Top or Bottom layer. Don't need to consider BO in the inner layer.
M1+M2MS, DSL, SL115DSL may cause via stub to be longer than the maximum required 250um. Via stub mitigation routing technique may be employed.
M3MS, SL20
CableCable255This cable length assumes a FFC cable with the insertion loss of 5.6dB at Nyquist frequency

Min Length Total Note:

Max Length Total (mm): 134

Max Length Total Note: BO+M1+M2+M3<= 135mm. If 90% of the routings are implemented in stripline traces, M1+M2 length can be extended to 135mm & BO+M1+M2+M3<=155mm. Max length not including cable.

TCP TBT5 Cascaded Retimer Topology

TCP TBT5 Cascaded Retimer Topology
TCP TBT5 Cascaded Retimer Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS main route routing is needed, 800µm spacing to equivalent signal (S-ES) is required between differential pairs. In cases where spacing to equivalent signal (S-ES) must be decreased due to breakout and break-in region routing constraints, ensure to gradually widen the spacing from 375um back to the standard 800µm to preserve signal integrity. Minimize length of section of routing that has less than 800um spacing. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
ESDPlease refer to Thunderbolt Retimer documentation for more details. Refer to RDC #843990 for June Bridge 80 Retimer guidelines.
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor 0201 required - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported For the pre-channel cap - Form factor 0201 recommended - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 required. - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5% Form factor: 0201.
Rc resistor value2.2 Ω ± 10% Form factor: 0201 When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 Ω ± 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 Ω ± 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 Ω ± 5%.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerJune Bridge 80
CIO topology PlacementESD Diode, AC cap, Rb Resistor and Rc Resistor should be placed as close as possible to USBC connector up to 8mm radius.
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads5.8 dB @ 13 GHz on PCB. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 5.0, Thunderbolt 4.0, USB4.0 Gen3, USB3.2 Gen2x2 and DP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes

Rx, Tx2Post-ChannelNo via stub length allowed.

(Internal) TCP TBT5 Retimer M.2 Modular Topology

TCP TBT5 Retimer M.2 Modular Topology Diagram
(Internal) TCP TBT5 Retimer M.2 Modular Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS main route routing is needed, 800µm spacing to equivalent signal (S-ES) is required between differential pairs. In cases where spacing to equivalent signal (S-ES) must be decreased due to breakout and break-in region routing constraints, ensure to gradually widen the spacing from 375um back to the standard 800µm to preserve signal integrity. Minimize length of section of routing that has less than 800um spacing. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
ESDPlease refer to Thunderbolt Retimer documentation for more details. Refer to RDC #843990 for June Bridge Retimer 80 guidelines.
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor 0201 required - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported For the pre-channel cap - Form factor 0201 recommended - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 required. - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5% Form factor: 0201.
Rc resistor value2.2 Ω - Form factor: 0201. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 Ω ± 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 Ω ± 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 Ω ± 5%.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerJune Bridge 80
Total insertion loss budget from CPU pins to retimer pins17 dB @ 10 GHz. Inclusive of HVM variation.
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector padsUp to 5.8dB @ 13GHz Ball to RCP pad (w/o connector). Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 5.0, Thunderbolt 4.0, USB4.0 Gen3, USB3.2 Gen2x2 and DP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
M.2 Module InformationGuidelines compatible with: TCSS-707 and TCSS-109
CIO topology PlacementESD Diode, AC cap, Rb Resistor and Rc Resistor should be placed as close as possible to USBC connector up to 8mm radius.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Rx, Tx2Pre-ChannelMaximum via stub length 250um.
Rx, Tx2Post-ChannelNo via stub length allowed.
