TCP AUX With Retimer Internal Cable Topology

TCP AUX With Retimer Internal Cable Topology Diagram
TCP AUX With Retimer Internal Cable Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedNo explicit limit, use best known routing practices.
Transmission line referencingReference planes can be continuous ground or continuous power that have low frequency peak to peak noise. Ground referencing is preferred.
500 mm cable assembly75 - 100 Ω including tolerance. Insertion loss ≥ -1.0 dB @ 1 MHz.
ESD / EOSRefer to RDC #843990 for June Bridge.
RetimerJune Bridge
Cs cap value47 pF nominal.
Edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism such as a 47 pF capacitor (Cs) terminated to VSS is recommended. Cs cap is optional.
AC cap valueNominal 100nF recommended (75nF to 200nF including tolerance).

M1+M2MS, DSL, SL450

TCP USB3.2

TCP USB3.2 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackup0402, if routing near maximum length it is recommended to use 0201 component size.
Recommended short protection circuitIt is recommended to include this circuit to comply with USB ECN \"RX AC Coupling Capacitor Option\" to provide ESD/ EOS protection and set RX bias at the Type-C connector. Intel's recommendation on DC rating of the Crx is 25 V. The customer should consider short event to VBUS that can be up to 20 V.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs, AC cap and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left as no connect at the BGA ball.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#: 726825
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, only a single continuous power reference plane is permitted on one side, but the other side must be a continuous ground. Simulation is needed to ensure electrical requirements are met.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, only a single continuous power reference plane is permitted on one side, but the other side must be a continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Simulation is needed to ensure electrical requirements are met.
TCP USB3.2 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25

TCP USB3.2 Gen1x1 Type-A Main Link Topology

TCP USB3.2 Gen1x1 Type-A Main Link Topology Diagram
TCP USB3.2 Gen1x1 Type-A Main Link Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length375 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground, and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
CMCRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for CMC recommendation(s).
ESDRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s).
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 63 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Supported interfacesUSB3.2 Gen1 (5 Gbps)
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Rx, Tx3Total ChannelRoute within 2 layers.

M5Trace910

Requirement for Third Party Active Component
TCP USB3.2 Gen2x1 Type-A Redriver Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Implementation guidelinesMax/min routing length for USB3.2 Gen2 speed (10 Gbps) depends on repeater performance and its loss compensation capability when used in conjunction with Intel CPU. Work with repeater vendor to ensure the selected part can provide adequate signal integrity at the CPU.

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
TXDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
M2Trace3-1

SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BOMS, DSL, SL8

Max Length Total (mm): 90

(Internal) TCP USB3.2 Gen2x1 Type-A Redriver M.2 Modular Topology

TCP USB3.2 Gen2x1 Type-A Redriver M.2 Modular Topology Diagram
Requirement for Third Party Active Component
(Internal) TCP USB3.2 Gen2x1 Type-A Redriver M.2 Modular Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Implementation guidelinesMax/min routing length for USB3.2 Gen2 speed (10 Gbps) depends on repeater performance and its loss compensation capability when used in conjunction with Intel PCH. Work with repeater vendor to ensure the selected part can provide adequate signal integrity at the PCH.

Max Length Total (mm): 190

(Internal) TCP USB3.2 Gen1x1 Type-A Internal Cable Topology

TCP USB3.2 Gen1x1 Type-A Internal Cable Topology Diagram
(Internal) TCP USB3.2 Gen1x1 Type-A Internal Cable Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length375 um
CMCRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for CMC recommendation(s)
ESDRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s)
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 63 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 63 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5%, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 63 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
203 mm cable assembly76-94 Ω including tolerance. Insertion loss ≥ -2.5 dB @ 2.5 GHz, ≥ -3.3 dB @ 5.0 GHz. Crosstalk ≤ -33 dB @ 5-10 GHz.
Supported interfacesUSB3.2 Gen2x2 and USB3.2 Gen2x1 (10 Gbps per lane); DP v1.4a (8.1 Gbps per lane).
Length trade-off for mainstream stackupIf 60 mm < BO+M[1:6] ≤ 85 mm then Mcable ≤ 127 mm.
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedNotes
Rx, Tx4Route within 2 layers.

(Internal) TCP USB3.2 Gen2x1 Type-A Internal Cable Topology

TCP USB3.2 Gen2x1 Type-A Internal Cable Topology Diagram
(Internal) TCP USB3.2 Gen2x1 Type-A Internal Cable Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length375 um
CMCRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for CMC recommendation(s)
ESDRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s)
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 63 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 63 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5%, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 63 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
203 mm cable assembly76-94 Ω including tolerance. Insertion loss ≥ -2.5 dB @ 2.5 GHz, ≥ -3.3 dB @ 5.0 GHz. Crosstalk ≤ -33 dB @ 5-10 GHz.
Supported interfacesUSB3.2 Gen2x2 and USB3.2 Gen2x1 (10 Gbps per lane); DP v1.4a (8.1 Gbps per lane).
Length trade-off for mainstream stackupIf 60 mm < BO+M[1:6] ≤ 85 mm then Mcable ≤ 127 mm.
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedNotes
Rx, Tx4Route within 2 layers.

eUSB2

eUSB2 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
eUSB2 routing shall comply to USB 2.0 DCR ECN for D+ and D- maximum series DC resistance (DCR) specification.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
eUSB2 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.381
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

USB2.0

USB2.0 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
USB 2.0 routing shall comply to USB 2.0 DCR ECN for D+ and D- maximum series DC resistance (DCR) specification.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825

Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch

2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

CPU USB3.2 Gen1

USB3.2 Stub Requirement
USB3.2 Component Routing Requirement
USB3.2 Component Pad Voiding Requirement
USB3.2 Receptacle Ground Void Dimension Recommendations
USB3.2 Signals to PTH Transition Requirement
CPU USB3.2 Gen1 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Stub requirementChannel and via stub requirement must meet < 381 um for both Tx and Rx signal pairs.
Tx AC cap value for USB3.2 Gen1 & Gen2AC capacitor value: 100 nF nominal (75 nF - 265 nF range).
Short circuit protection for Type-C topology (if applicable)Crx cap value: 297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V. Rb resistor value: 220 kΩ ± 5%.
Component size requirement ( CMC, ESD, AC cap, Resistor)Strongly recommended to use 0201 components for better impedance control.
Component voidingAll component pads must be voided on L2 and with GND reference on L3. Suggest having pad voiding size of 50.8 um overcut. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Component routingSignal pair to entry/ exist from components pad symmetrically. Maintain differential routing to meet trace target impedance whenever possible.
Signal PTH/ via transitionDifferential pair voiding needed for each signal pair transition with recommended antipad size of 0.75 mm. Suggest having two symmetrical GND stitching vias for each signal pair transition.
Cable and connector recommendationStrongly recommended to use SMT connectors. For PTH connectors (assuming connector is on the top), USB3.2 signals need to be routed from the bottom of the board such that there is no stub on for connector entry. Intel strongly recommends selecting cables and connectors which meet electrical requirements specified in both USB-IF Cable and Connector Specification dated June 2017 and Universal Serial Bus 3.1 Legacy Connectors and Cable Assemblies Compliance dated April 2018. The USB-IF does not certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen2 stacked connectors. The USB-IF does certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen1 stacked connectors. Refer USB-IF for more details.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential oval antipad required for all layers. Suggest using differential signal antipad with 2 mm size.
Repeater pad voidingA differential void on L2 that is larger than the repeater with 50.8 um overcut is recommended. GND referencing is needed on L3. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Routing schemeNon-interleaved breakout (B0) is required to mitigate near-end crosstalk. The main route (MR) supports both interleaved routing and non-interleaved routing for maximum flexibility on stripline (SL). For microstrip (MS), interleaved routing scheme is recommended.
Reference planeContinuous GND is recommended. If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). If non-continuous power referencing is unavoidable on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
ConnectorDO NOT use UDE RUP-GB-0030 with RJ45 Type A connector
CPU USB3.2 Gen1 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

NoteDetail
Cable assumptionsThis assumes internal cable assembly insertion loss of ~2 dB @ 2.5 GHz, ~3 dB @ 5.0 GHz. Refer to USB3.2 "Front-Panel Internal Cable And Connector White Paper" for more details.
ESDRefer to Electromagnetic Compatibility chapter (ESD Diode Selection).

Refer to USB 3.2 FRONT-PANEL INTERNAL CABLE AND CONNECTOR White Paper for more details.

USB3.2 Gen1x1 Type-A Internal Cable With Redriver Topology

USB3.2 Gen1x1 Type-A Internal Cable With Redriver Topology Diagram
Requirement for Third Party Active Component
USB3.2 Gen1x1 Type-A Internal Cable With Redriver Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Cable assumptionsThis assumes internal cable insertion loss of ~3 dB @ 5 GHz. Refer to USB3.2 "Front-Panel Internal Cable And Connector White Paper" for more details.
Implementation guidelinesMax/min routing length for USB3.2 Gen1 speed (5 Gbps) depends on repeater performance and its loss compensation capability when used in conjunction with Intel CPU. Work with repeater vendor to ensure the selected part can provide adequate signal integrity at the CPU.
ESDPlease consult with the redriver vendor to determine the appropriate ESD recommendation.

CPU USB3.2 Gen2

USB3.2 Stub Requirement
USB3.2 Component Routing Requirement
USB3.2 Component Pad Voiding Requirement
USB3.2 Receptacle Ground Void Dimension Recommendations
USB3.2 Signals to PTH Transition Requirement
CPU USB3.2 Gen2 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Stub requirementChannel and via stub requirement must meet < 381 um for both Tx and Rx signal pairs.
Tx AC cap value for USB3.2 Gen1 & Gen2AC capacitor value: 100 nF nominal (75 nF - 265 nF range).
Short circuit protection for Type-C topology (if applicable)Crx cap value: 297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V. Rb resistor value: 220 kΩ ± 5%.
Component size requirement ( CMC, ESD, AC cap, Resistor)Strongly recommended to use 0201 components for better impedance control.
Component voidingAll component pads must be voided on L2 and with GND reference on L3. Suggest having pad voiding size of 50.8 um overcut. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Component routingSignal pair to entry/ exist from components pad symmetrically. Maintain differential routing to meet trace target impedance whenever possible.
Signal PTH/ via transitionDifferential pair voiding needed for each signal pair transition with recommended antipad size of 0.75 mm. Suggest having two symmetrical GND stitching vias for each signal pair transition.
Cable and connector recommendationStrongly recommended to use SMT connectors. For PTH connectors (assuming connector is on the top), USB3.2 signals need to be routed from the bottom of the board such that there is no stub on for connector entry. Intel strongly recommends selecting cables and connectors which meet electrical requirements specified in both USB-IF Cable and Connector Specification dated June 2017 and Universal Serial Bus 3.1 Legacy Connectors and Cable Assemblies Compliance dated April 2018. The USB-IF does not certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen2 stacked connectors. The USB-IF does certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen1 stacked connectors. Refer USB-IF for more details.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential oval antipad required for all layers. Suggest using differential signal antipad with 2 mm size.
Repeater pad voidingA differential void on L2 that is larger than the repeater with 50.8 um overcut is recommended. GND referencing is needed on L3. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Routing schemeNon-interleaved breakout (B0) is required to mitigate near-end crosstalk. The main route (MR) supports both interleaved routing and non-interleaved routing for maximum flexibility on stripline (SL). For microstrip (MS), interleaved routing scheme is recommended.
Reference planeContinuous GND is recommended. If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). If non-continuous power referencing is unavoidable on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
ConnectorDO NOT use UDE RUP-GB-0030 with RJ45 Type A connector
CPU USB3.2 Gen2 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

USB3.2 Gen2x1 Type-A Internal Cable With Redriver Topology

USB3.2 Gen2x1 Type-A Internal Cable With Redriver Topology Diagram
Requirement for Third Party Active Component
USB3.2 Gen2x1 Type-A Internal Cable With Redriver Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Cable assumptionsThis assumes internal cable insertion loss of ~3 dB @ 5 GHz. Refer to USB3.2 "Front-Panel Internal Cable And Connector White Paper" for more details.
Implementation guidelinesMax/min routing length for USB3.2 Gen2 speed (10 Gbps) depends on repeater performance and its loss compensation capability when used in conjunction with Intel CPU. Work with repeater vendor to ensure the selected part can provide adequate signal integrity at the CPU.
ESDPlease consult with redriver vendor to determine the appropriate ESD recommendation.

PCH USB3.2 Gen1

USB3.2 Stub Requirement
USB3.2 Component Routing Requirement
USB3.2 Component Pad Voiding Requirement
USB3.2 Receptacle Ground Void Dimension Recommendations
USB3.2 Signals to PTH Transition Requirement
PCH USB3.2 Gen1 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Stub requirementChannel and via stub requirement must meet < 381 um for both Tx and Rx signal pairs.
Tx AC cap value for USB3.2 Gen1 & Gen2AC capacitor value: 100 nF nominal (75 nF - 265 nF range).
Short circuit protection for Type-C topology (if applicable)Crx cap value: 297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V. Rb resistor value: 220 kΩ ± 5%.
Component size requirement ( CMC, ESD, AC cap, Resistor)Strongly recommended to use 0201 components for better impedance control.
Component voidingAll component pads must be voided on L2 and with GND reference on L3. Suggest having pad voiding size of 50.8 um overcut. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Component routingSignal pair to entry/ exist from components pad symmetrically. Maintain differential routing to meet trace target impedance whenever possible.
Signal PTH/ via transitionDifferential pair voiding needed for each signal pair transition with recommended antipad size of 0.75 mm. Suggest having two symmetrical GND stitching vias for each signal pair transition.
Cable and connector recommendationStrongly recommended to use SMT connectors. For PTH connectors (assuming connector is on the top), USB3.2 signals need to be routed from the bottom of the board such that there is no stub on for connector entry. Intel strongly recommends selecting cables and connectors which meet electrical requirements specified in both USB-IF Cable and Connector Specification dated June 2017 and Universal Serial Bus 3.1 Legacy Connectors and Cable Assemblies Compliance dated April 2018. The USB-IF does not certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen2 stacked connectors. The USB-IF does certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen1 stacked connectors. Refer USB-IF for more details.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential oval antipad required for all layers. Suggest using differential signal antipad with 2 mm size.
Repeater pad voidingA differential void on L2 that is larger than the repeater with 50.8 um overcut is recommended. GND referencing is needed on L3. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Routing schemeNon-interleaved breakout (B0) is required to mitigate near-end crosstalk. The main route (MR) supports both interleaved routing and non-interleaved routing for maximum flexibility on stripline (SL). For microstrip (MS), interleaved routing scheme is recommended.
Reference planeContinuous GND is recommended. If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). If non-continuous power referencing is unavoidable on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
ConnectorDO NOT use UDE RUP-GB-0030 with RJ45 Type A connector
PCH USB3.2 Gen1 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

PCH USB3.2 Gen2

USB3.2 Stub Requirement
USB3.2 Component Routing Requirement
USB3.2 Component Pad Voiding Requirement
USB3.2 Receptacle Ground Void Dimension Recommendations
USB3.2 Signals to PTH Transition Requirement
PCH USB3.2 Gen2 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Stub requirementChannel and via stub requirement must meet < 381 um for both Tx and Rx signal pairs.
Tx AC cap value for USB3.2 Gen1 & Gen2AC capacitor value: 100 nF nominal (75 nF - 265 nF range).
Short circuit protection for Type-C topology (if applicable)Crx cap value: 297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V. Rb resistor value: 220 kΩ ± 5%.
Component size requirement ( CMC, ESD, AC cap, Resistor)Strongly recommended to use 0201 components for better impedance control.
Component voidingAll component pads must be voided on L2 and with GND reference on L3. Suggest having pad voiding size of 50.8 um overcut. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Component routingSignal pair to entry/ exist from components pad symmetrically. Maintain differential routing to meet trace target impedance whenever possible.
Signal PTH/ via transitionDifferential pair voiding needed for each signal pair transition with recommended antipad size of 0.75 mm. Suggest having two symmetrical GND stitching vias for each signal pair transition.
Cable and connector recommendationStrongly recommended to use SMT connectors. For PTH connectors (assuming connector is on the top), USB3.2 signals need to be routed from the bottom of the board such that there is no stub on for connector entry. Intel strongly recommends selecting cables and connectors which meet electrical requirements specified in both USB-IF Cable and Connector Specification dated June 2017 and Universal Serial Bus 3.1 Legacy Connectors and Cable Assemblies Compliance dated April 2018. The USB-IF does not certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen2 stacked connectors. The USB-IF does certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen1 stacked connectors. Refer USB-IF for more details.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential oval antipad required for all layers. Suggest using differential signal antipad with 2 mm size.
Repeater pad voidingA differential void on L2 that is larger than the repeater with 50.8 um overcut is recommended. GND referencing is needed on L3. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Routing schemeNon-interleaved breakout (B0) is required to mitigate near-end crosstalk. The main route (MR) supports both interleaved routing and non-interleaved routing for maximum flexibility on stripline (SL). For microstrip (MS), interleaved routing scheme is recommended.
Reference planeContinuous GND is recommended. If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). If non-continuous power referencing is unavoidable on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
ConnectorDO NOT use UDE RUP-GB-0030 with RJ45 Type A connector
PCH USB3.2 Gen2 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

(Internal) CLK PCIe4 and USB4 RefCLK Topology

Description: Internal Debug Clocks

(Internal) CLK PCIe4 and USB4 RefCLK Topology Diagram
(Internal) CLK PCIe4 and USB4 RefCLK Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Max length / Min lengthThere is no max length, though a typical estimated length is about 203.2 mm (8"). Minimum length of channel is 101.6 mm (4") to mitigate channel overshoot.
Shunt resistor placementShunt resistors (on each DP/DN signal) should be placed as close as possible to the CPU (receiver point). The max placement should be no further than about 25 mm (1") from the CPU.
PCH associated signals PCIe_ExtRefClk (P/N) DMI_RefClk (P/N)
CPU associated signals PCIe5_RefClk_Ext [0] (P/N) PCIe5_RefClk_Ext [1] (P/N) PCIe5_RefClk_Ext [2] (P/N) USB4_RefClk_Ext (P/N)
Signal routing guidelinesFollow standard differential routing guidelines for impedance and spacing, similar to baseline differential clocks.

Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx

Category: Mainstream

Material: Premium Mid Loss (PML)

Signal Group: Rx

Redriver/Retimer: None

(Internal) CLK PCIe4 and USB4 RefCLK Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BO+M1MS, DSL, SL25
M2MS, DSL, SL203

Max Length Total (mm): 203

Max Length Total Note: Max length is typical length, but there is no theoretical max length upper bound.

CLK PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Clock Topology

PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Clock Topology Diagram
Differential Clock Shielding
CLK PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Clock Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Signal isolationDifferential SRC Clocks supporting PCIe Gen4 devices require 0.76 mm isolation to adjacent high speed IOs. Isolation to USB2 and low-speed IOs can be maintained at 0.5 mm.
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
EMC/ RF noise protection[1] For signal sections routed as microstrip on surface layer, a GND ring/ shield is advised to be added (follow standard GND ring/ shield guidelines for XTAL) with sufficient GND stitching vias for the length of the microstrip trace. [2] GND ring/ shield stitching vias should be placed at regular intervals of 4 - 12 mm. [3] It is advised to route in inner layer as stripline/ dual stripline routing. Limit microstrip routing and follow above shielding guidelines.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias Allowed

CLK PCIe Gen5 Add-in Card Clock Topology

PCIe Gen5 Add-in Card Clock Topology Diagram
Differential Clock Shielding
CLK PCIe Gen5 Add-in Card Clock Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Signal isolationDifferential SRC Clocks supporting PCIe Gen5 devices require 0.76 mm isolation to adjacent high speed IOs. Isolation to USB2 and low-speed IOs can be maintained at 0.5 mm.
Reference planeContinuous ground only
EMC/ RF noise protection[1] For signal sections routed as microstrip on surface layer, a GND ring/ shield is advised to be added (follow standard GND ring/ shield guidelines for XTAL) with sufficient GND stitching vias for the length of the microstrip trace. [2] GND ring/ shield stitching vias should be placed at regular intervals of 4 - 12 mm. [3] It is advised to route in inner layer as stripline/ dual stripline routing. Limit microstrip routing and follow above shielding guidelines. [4] GND ring/ shield spacing to signal should be 4x the dielectric height of the stackup or approximately 300 um (whichever is larger). Clock signal spacing to other signals should follow the signal isolation guidelines . [5] GND ring/ shield width should be 2x the dielectric height of the stackup or approximately 140 um (whichever is larger).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias Allowed
Tx4

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
TXDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
M2Trace34
M3Trace45
M4Trace56
ConnectorDevice6-1

Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Tx

Category: Mainstream

Material: Premium Mid Loss (PML)

Signal Group: Tx

Redriver/Retimer: None

CLK PCIe Gen5 Add-in Card Clock Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Tx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL12.7
M1 + M2+M3MS, DSL, SL
M4MS25.4
McardMS76.2Assumes an add-in card of 50.4 to 76.2 mm.

Min Length Total (mm): 50.8

Min Length Total Note: M_MB_TOTAL = BO + M1 + M2 + M3+M4 : 50.8 (assumes Mcard is 76.2mm)

Max Length Total (mm): 254.2

Max Length Total Note: M_MB_TOTAL = BO + M1 + M2 + M3+M4: 50.4 mm to 178 mm (assuming 76 mm add-in card length) ; If Mcard increases in length, M_MB_TOTAL must reduce in length accordingly.

CLK PCIe Gen5 Device Down Clock Topology

CLK PCIe Gen5 Device Down Clock Topology Diagram
Differential Clock Shielding
CLK PCIe Gen5 Device Down Clock Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Signal isolationDifferential SRC Clocks supporting PCIe Gen5 devices require 0.76 mm isolation to adjacent high speed IOs. Isolation to USB2 and low-speed IOs can be maintained at 0.5 mm.
Reference planeContinuous ground only
EMC/ RF noise protection[1] For signal sections routed as microstrip on surface layer, a GND ring/ shield is advised to be added (follow standard GND ring/ shield guidelines for XTAL) with sufficient GND stitching vias for the length of the microstrip trace. [2] GND ring/ shield stitching vias should be placed at regular intervals of 4 - 12 mm. [3] It is advised to route in inner layer as stripline/ dual stripline routing. Limit microstrip routing and follow above shielding guidelines. [4] GND ring/ shield spacing to signal should be 4x the dielectric height of the stackup or approximately 300 um (whichever is larger). Clock signal spacing to other signals should follow the signal isolation guidelines . [5] GND ring/ shield width should be 2x the dielectric height of the stackup or approximately 140 um (whichever is larger).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias Allowed
Tx4

Differential Clock (PCH-CPU Support)

Differential Clock (PCH-CPU Support) General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Applicable to PCH and CPU All guidelines are applicable to clock signals originating from both the PCH and the CPU.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
Differential Clock (PCH-CPU Support) Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.254
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

(Internal) DMI RefCLK Topology

Description: Internal Debug Clocks

(Internal) DMI RefCLK Topology Diagram
(Internal) DMI RefCLK Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Max length / Min lengthThere is no max length, though a typical estimated length is about 203.2 mm (8"). Minimum length of channel is 101.6 mm (4") to mitigate channel overshoot.
Shunt resistor placementShunt resistors (on each DP/DN signal) should be placed as close as possible to the CPU (receiver point). The max placement should be no further than about 25 mm (1") from the CPU.
PCH associated signals PCIe_ExtRefClk (P/N) DMI_RefClk (P/N)
CPU associated signals PCIe5_RefClk_Ext [0] (P/N) PCIe5_RefClk_Ext [1] (P/N) PCIe5_RefClk_Ext [2] (P/N) USB4_RefClk_Ext (P/N)
Signal routing guidelinesFollow standard differential routing guidelines for impedance and spacing, similar to baseline differential clocks.

Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx

Category: Mainstream

Material: Premium Mid Loss (PML)

Signal Group: Rx

Redriver/Retimer: None

(Internal) DMI RefCLK Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BO+M1MS, DSL, SL25
M2MS, DSL, SL203

Max Length Total (mm): 203

Max Length Total Note: Max length is typical length, but there is no theoretical max length upper bound.

CPU DMI CLK to PCH Topology

CPU DMI CLK to PCH Topology Diagram
CPU DMI CLK to PCH Topology Notes
NoteDetail
CPU DMI CLK signal nameCLKOUT_SRC_P/N. Note: DMI CLK can be mapped to any CLKOUT_SRC.
PCH DMI CLK signal nameEXT_INJ_PHY P/N
Signal isolationClock signals require 0.76 mm isolation to adjacent high speed IOs. Isolation to other differential clocks, USB2 and low-speed IOs can be maintained at 0.5 mm.
EMC/ RF noise protection[1] For signal sections of the signals which are routed on MS (surface) layer, a GND ring/ shield is advised to be added (with similar guidelines following a standard GND ring/shield such as for XTAL) with sufficient GND stitching vias for the length of the MS routed layer. [2] GND ring/ shield GND stitching vias should be placed at regular intervals of 4 - 12 mm. [3] It is advised to route the clock signals in inner layer SL/ DSL routing. Limit MS routed section and follow above shielding guidelines.
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias Allowed

M1Trace23

RXDevice4-1

EMC/ RF noise protection1] For signal sections of the signals which are routed on MS (surface) layer, a GND ring/ shield is advised to be added with sufficient GND stitching vias for the length of the MS routed layer. [2] GND ring/ shield GND stitching vias should be placed at regular intervals of 4 - 12 mm. [3] It is advised to route the clock signals in inner layer SL/ DSL routing. (Validation) UFS4.0

Description: UFS in NVL support gear5 data rate.

(Validation) UFS4.0 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Stub requirementChannel and via stub requirement must meet < 254 um for both Tx and Rx signal pairs.
Component voidingAll component pads must be voided on L2 and with GND reference on L3. Suggest having pad voiding size of 50.8 um overcut. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Component routingSignal pair to entry/ exist from components pad symmetrically. Maintain differential routing to meet trace target impedance whenever possible.
Signal PTH/ via transitionDifferential pair voiding needed for each signal pair transition with recommended antipad size of 0.75 mm. Suggest having two symmetrical GND stitching vias for each signal pair transition.
Routing schemeNon-interleaved breakout (B0) is required to mitigate near-end crosstalk. The main route (MR) supports both interleaved routing and non-interleaved routing for maximum flexibility on stripline (SL). For microstrip (MS), interleaved routing scheme is recommended.
Reference planeContinuous GND is recommended. If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). If non-continuous power referencing is unavoidable on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
(Validation) UFS4.0 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.127
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes12.7
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes12.7
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

CLINK 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

CLINK 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
CLINK 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum trace DC resistance 11 Ω
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals25.4 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm

CNVi BRI and RGI

CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load Topology

CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load M.2 Connector Topology Diagram
CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load Module Down Topology Diagram
CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Max frequency40 MHz
M4 (BRI_RSP)For microstrip and stripline routing only on platform, the total main board trace length can be extended up to 254 mm. For that, it is recommended to implement M4 < 228.6 mm (max).
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended for microstrip line. [2] Dual continuous GND is recommended for strip line. [3] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [4] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
R110 Ω ± 5% for max total length ≥ 25.4 mm. To be placed 12.7 mm (can be extended to 25.4 mm) from the CPU for CNV_BRI_DT and CNV_RGI_DT signal.
R2 (RGI)For Wi-Fi 7 BE201, Wi-Fi 7 BE211 and Wi-Fi 7 BE213; 27 Ω ± 5% for max total length ≥ 25.4 mm. To be placed 12.7 mm from the connector for CNV_RGI_RSP signal.
R2 (BRI)For Wi-Fi 7 BE211 and Wi-Fi 7 BE213; 27 Ω ± 5% for max total length ≥ 25.4 mm. For Wi-Fi 7 BE201; [1] 10 Ω ± 5% for max total length ≥ 101.6 mm [2] 27 Ω ± 5% for max total length < 101.6 mm To be placed 12.7 mm from the connector for CNV_BRI_RSP signal.
Length restriction for full Dual Stripline routingM1 + M2 = 63.5 mm (max). M3 + M4 = 63.5 mm (max).
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Signal name/ listCNV_BRI_DT, CNV_RGI_DT, CNV_BRI_RSP, CNV_RGI_RSP.

CPU and PCH GPIO

CPU and PCH GPIO CMOS Buffer Type Topology

CPU and PCH GPIO 1-Load Topology Diagram
CPU and PCH GPIO Multiload Topology Diagram
Formula for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor
Example of Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation
CPU and PCH GPIO CMOS Buffer Type Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Total trace lengthTotal trace length options as below: [1] Total trace length BO + M1 + BI =< 177.8 mm, or [2] Total trace length BO + M2 + BI =< 177.8 mm, or [3] Total trace length BO + Mn + BI =< 177.8 mm.
Strapping resistor, R_strap20 kΩ on need basis, for strapping purposes. Resistor can be either pull-up or pull-down depending on strapping design.
Number of vias allowedNo restriction.
Reference planeNo restriction.
Note 1R_strap resistor is optional depending on signal needs and can be anywhere along M1, M2, Mn lane. Refer to EDS or device datasheet for the requirement.
Note 2Main route of Mn can start anywhere along M1 as long as the total length of each branch from CPU/ PCH to device is less than 177.8 mm.
Note 3R_strap resistor value depends on power sequence/ strapping's timing and DC voltage level requirement (refer below for calculation details).
Note 4Level shifter may be needed depending on actual device implementation. Generally no length restriction after level shifter.
Note 5For CPU/ PCH input-only signal, if device output is open drain buffer type, then proper pull-up resistor, Rpu is needed and refer to "Rise Time and R_strap or Rpu Calculation" section for details.
Note 6Noise sensitive GPIO pin should be properly shielded/ with sufficient trace spacing (e.g.: 3x of trace width). This is to prevent undesirable random system reset.
Rise time and R_strap or Rpu calculation
R_strap or Rpu formulaRefer image [Formula for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor].
Bus capacitance rule of thumb, CbDevice = 10 pF per device. Board trace = 3.3 pF per 25.4 mm of trace length.
Example[1] Total bus length = 10 inches --> 10 x 3.3pF = 33 pF. [2] Branch topology with two devices --> 2 x 10 pF = 20 pF. [3] With a rise time requirement (tr) = 1 us. Refer image [Example for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation].

Segment Lengths

CPU and PCH GPIO CMOS Buffer Type Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BOMS, SL12.7
M1MS, SL177.6
BIMS, SL12.7

Max Length Total (mm): 203

[For Internal Reference] GPIO Open Drain Buffer Type Topology

Description: Note: For internal reference only! Do not publish in external PDG!

Formula for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor
Example for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation
[For Internal Reference] GPIO Open Drain Buffer Type Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Note 1No length/ topology restriction.
Note 2Pull-up resistor, Rpu can be calculated based on rise time requirement (refer to "Rise time and R_strap or Rpu calculation" section for details). Rise time requirement may varies depending on device requirement (if any), refer to device data sheet.
Note 3Intel input buffer does not have any rise/ fall time requirement. For device TX open drain signal, refer to device's design guide or Intel reference schematic for pull-up resistor value.
Rise time and R_strap or Rpu calculation
R_strap or Rpu formulaRefer image [Formula for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor].
Bus capacitance rule of thumb, CbDevice = 10 pF per device. Board trace = 3.3 pF per 25.4 mm of trace length.
Example[1] Total bus length = 10 inches --> 10 x 3.3pF = 33 pF. [2] Branch topology with two devices --> 2 x 10 pF = 20 pF. [3] With a rise time requirement (tr) = 1 us. Refer image [Example for Strapping or Pull-up Resistor Calculation].

DMIC

DMIC 2-Load Branch Topology

DMIC 2-Load Branch CLK Topology Diagram
DMIC 2-Load Branch DATA Topology Diagram
DMIC 2-Load Branch Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R1 & C1[1] EMI RC filter placeholder: Stuff R1 with 0 Ω and unstuff C1 by default. Refer to EMC section for details. [2] To be placed only for DMIC_CLK. [3] C1 is recommended to be placed close to R1. C1 is recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from the CPU but can be extended to 25.4 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum. If M1 is routed on MS, EMI RC filter should be placed at the beginning of the MS routing.
R250 Ω. [1] R2 is recommended to be placed immediate after the branches. [2] If the branches not immediately split after connector, please follow rule [1].
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between branchBranch 1 and branch 2 need to be length matched within 2.54 mm.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signalsN/A
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D: 40 Ω. [2] GPP_S: 50 Ω, slew 11.
Signal name/ listDMIC_CLK_A[0:1], DMICA_CLK_A[0:1], DMIC_DATA[0:1],DMICA_DATA[0:1].
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias Allowed
Rx7
Tx7

R1 & C1[1] EMI RC filter placeholder: Stuff R1 with 0 Ω and unstuff C1 by default. Refer to EMC section for details. [2] To be placed only for DMIC_CLK. [3] C1 is recommended to be placed close to R1. C1 is recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from the PCH but can be extended to 25.4 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum. If M1 is routed on MS, EMI RC filter should be placed at the beginning of the MS routing.
R250 Ω. R2 is recommended to be placed immediate after the branches.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between CLK and DATA signalsN/A

eSPI

eSPI 1-Load (Device Down) Topology

eSPI 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Diagram
eSPI 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency50 MHz
Device assumptionCompliant to Intel ESPI Base Specification 1.0 (66 MHz and above).
R130 Ω ± 5% on ESPI_CLK and ESPI_IO[0:3].
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
CPU Buffer drive strength33 Ω.

eSPI 2-Load Branch (Device Down) Topology

eSPI 2-Load Branch (Device Down) Topology Diagram
eSPI 2-Load Branch (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency[1] Device 1: EC at 50 MHz. [2] Device 2: SIO at 33 MHz.
Device assumptionCompliant to Intel ESPI Base Specification 1.0 (66 MHz and above).
R10 Ω placeholder for ESPI_CLK and ESPI_IO[0:3].
R25 Ω ± 5% for ESPI_CLK and ESPI_IO[0:3].
R3100 Ω ± 5% for ESPI_CLK and ESPI_IO[0:3].
CPU buffer drive strength33 Ω.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listESPI_CLK, ESPI_IO[0:3], ESPI_CS[0:1]#, ESPI_ALERT[0:1]#, ESPI_RESET#.
Max Number of vias

eSPI 2-Load Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology

eSPI 2-Load Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology Diagram
eSPI 2-Load Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency[1] Device 1: EC at 50 MHz. [2] Device 2: PCH.IOE at 33 MHz.
Device assumptionCompliant to Intel ESPI Base Specification 1.0 (66 MHz and above).
R10 Ω placeholder for ESPI_CLK and ESPI_IO[0:3].
R25 Ω ± 5% for ESPI_CLK and ESPI_IO[0:3].
R3100 Ω ± 5% for ESPI_CLK and ESPI_IO[0:3].
CPU buffer drive strength33 Ω.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ list[1] CPU package ballout name: ESPI_CLK, ESPI_IO[0:3], ESPI_CS0#, ESPI_CS3#, ESPI_ALERT0#, ESPI_ALERT3#, ESPI_RESET#. [2] PCH package ballout name: DIR_ESPI_CLK, DIR_eSPI_IO_[0:3], DIR_ESPI_CS0.

FORCEPR#

FORCEPR# Topology

FORCEPR# Topology Diagram
FORCEPR# Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R-1, R-2, R-n75 Ω ≤ R-n + Dev-n drive strength ≤ 200 Ω. [1] Drive strength of each device should be controlled within 75 Ω to 200 Ω, use an additional resistor if the device drive strength is too strong. [2] Optionally, if the device drive strength is ≥ 75 Ω (weak), R-n is not needed. [3] Recommended to be placed < 127 mm from respective device.
Rpu2.2 kΩ ± 20%. Total length can be extended up to 1524 mm. Refer to "FORCEPR# Topology Routing Length vs Rpu Guideline Table" for details.
Signal name/ listFORCEPR#

Segment Lengths

B0 + M1 + M2MS, DSL, SL889Max length for BO < 127 mm and M2 < 127 mm. Total length can be extended up to 1524 mm. Refer to "FORCEPR# Topology Routing Length vs Rpu Guideline Table" for details.

Max Length Total (mm): 889

GSPI

Description: GSPI

GSPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

GSPI 1-Load (Add-In-Card) Topology Diagram
GSPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency25 MHz
R10 Ω placeholder. To be placed on GSPI[0:1]_CLK, GSPI0A_CLK, GSPI[0:1]_MOSI and GSPI0A_MOSI.
R222 Ω ± 5%. To be placed on GSPI[0:1]_MISO and GSPI0A_MISO.
Device AC electrical and timing characteristics [1] Impedance: 50 Ω to 100 Ω. [2] 0.85 ns < rise/ fall time measured at 20%-80% < 1.9 ns based on 10 pF test load. [3] 1.6 pF ≤ input capacitance, Cin ≤ 1.75 pF. [4] Data input setup time < 9 ns. [5] Data input hold time < 5 ns. [6] 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 14 ns.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength50 Ω.
Signal name/ listGSPI[0:1]_CLK, GSPI[0:1]_MISO, GSPI[0:1]_MOSI, GSPI[0:1]_CS0#, GSPI0A_CLK, GSPI0A_MOSI, GSPI0A_MISO, GSPI0A_CS0#.

R10 Ω placeholder. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from the CPU, but can be extended to 76.2 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum.

Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).

[For Internal Validation] ISH-SPI 1-Load (Add-In Card with Cable) Topology

Description: This is a request from RVP to support 1-Load over cabling topology with operating frequency max 16 MHz

ISH-SPI 1-Load (Add-In Card + Cable) Topology Diagram
[For Internal Validation] ISH-SPI 1-Load (Add-In Card with Cable) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency16 MHz
Device AC timing characteristicsData input setup time < 5 ns. Data input hold time < 5 ns. 1 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 15 ns.
R10 Ω placeholder. To be placed on ISH_SPI_CLK, ISH_SPIA_CLK, ISH_SPI_MOSI and ISH_SPIA_MOSI.
R20 Ω placeholder. To be placed on ISH_SPI_MISO and ISH_SPIA_MISO.
Cable electrical characteristics-0.075 dB/inch < Insertion loss < -0.052 dB/inch -32.8 dB < Return loss < -46.2 dB -45.4 dB < Crosstalk < -47.2 dB 42 Ω < Impedance < 62 Ω
CPU buffer drive strength50 Ω.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listISH_SPI_CLK, ISH_SPI_MISO, ISH_SPI_MOSI, ISH_SPI_CS#, ISH_SPIA_CLK, ISH_SPIA_MISO, ISH_SPIA_MOSI, ISH_SPIA_CS#.
Max Number of vias

Segment Lengths

[For Internal Validation] ISH-SPI 1-Load (Add-In Card with Cable) Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL12.7
M1MS, DSL, SL12.7
M2MS, DSL, SL292.1
M3MS, DSL, SL12.7
CableCable304.8

Min Length Total (mm): 76.2

Max Length Total (mm): 635

Max Length Total Note: Total length of 635 mm can be supported with bus frequency needs to limit to 16 MHz.

I2C

I2C General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Note 1Multiple options for pull-up/ pull-down and current assist strengths are provided for a particular total bus capacitance. Choose the optimal value for system based on design considerations like power, BOM and cost.
Note 2Trace capacitance per inch is approximately CL = 85√єr / Zo pF, єr - dielectric constant of material, Zo - trace impedance.
Note 3Bus capacitance calculation assumptions: [1] Device capacitance = 5 pF to 10 pF per I2C device. [2] Motherboard board trace capacitance = 2 pF to 5 pF per inch of trace length. [3] CPU pin capacitance = 8 pF to 10 pF.

I2C Topology

I2C Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Stackup layer (microstrip/ stripline/ dual stripline)MS/ SL/ DSL.
Characteristic impedance30 Ω to 70 Ω.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Trace spacing between SCL and other signals [1] 0.375 mm: Frequency of other signals > 1 GHz. [2] 0.250 mm: Frequency of other signals > 100 MHz. [3] 0.125 mm: Frequency of other signals ≤ 100 MHz.
Trace spacing between SDA and other signals0.125 mm
Trace segment lengthRefer to bus capacitance table.
Total trace length (SDA, SCL)Individual trace lengths should meet total bus capacitance (Cb) requirements for the mode of operation. Refer to the pull-up/ pull-down tables for the supported bus capacitance.
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Pull-up resistor placementNo restriction.
Pull-up resistor value tolerance± 5%
Max stub length to pull-up resistor25.4 mm
Board trace characteristic assumptions for default pull-up recommendationBoard trace resistance per length = 20 Ω per meter. Board trace capacitance per length = 208 pF per meter.
Extended length supportFor extended length support, refer to "xxxxxx_NVL-Hx_I2C_SMLINK_LSIO_Flexi_PDG". Potential enablers: [1] Reduced trace resistance. [2] Reduced trace capacitance. [3] Optimized pull-up resistor placement.
Signal name/ listI2C[0:5]_SDA, I2C[0:5]_SCL, I2C[3A:5A]_SDA, I2C[3A:5A]_SCL, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SDA, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SCL, ISH_I2C2A_SDA, ISH_I2C2A_SCL, THC_I2C[0:1]_SCL, THC_I2C[0:1]_SDA.

Frequency: 400 kHz

Up to 50 pF3.3 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 100 pF1.5 kΩ100 Ω
70 pF to 200 pF820 Ω100 Ω
70 pF to 400 pF620 Ω100 Ω

60 pF to 300 pF300 Ω50 Ω

I2C for DDR5 SPD Topology

I2C for DDR5 SPD Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Stackup layer (microstrip/ stripline/ dual stripline)MS/ SL/ DSL.
Characteristic impedance30 Ω to 70 Ω.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Trace spacing between SCL and other signals [1] 0.375 mm: Frequency of other signals > 1 GHz. [2] 0.250 mm: Frequency of other signals > 100 MHz. [3] 0.125 mm: Frequency of other signals ≤ 100 MHz.
Trace spacing between SDA and other signals0.125 mm
Trace segment lengthRefer to bus capacitance table.
Total trace length (SDA, SCL)Individual trace lengths should meet total bus capacitance (Cb) requirements for the mode of operation. Refer to the pull-up/ pull-down tables for the supported bus capacitance.
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Pull-up resistor placementNo restriction.
Pull-up resistor value tolerance± 5%
Max stub length to pull-up resistor25.4 mm
Max stub length to device127 mm
Board trace characteristic assumptions for default pull-up recommendationBoard trace resistance per length = 20 Ω per meter. Board trace capacitance per length = 208 pF per meter.
Extended length supportFor extended length support, refer to "xxxxxx_NVL-Hx_I2C_SMLINK_LSIO_Flexi_PDG". Potential enablers: [1] Reduced trace resistance. [2] Reduced trace capacitance. [3] Optimized pull-up resistor placement.
Max SPD device input capacitance5 pF
General recommendations for DDR5 SPD[1] It is recommended to have a dedicated bus for DDR5 SPD usage. [2] If dedicated bus is not possible, it is recommended to use a voltage translator to shift the signal down to 1V to match the SPD device.
Signal name/ listI2C[0:5]_SDA, I2C[0:5]_SCL, I2C[3A:5A]_SDA, I2C[3A:5A]_SCL, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SDA, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SCL, ISH_I2C2A_SDA, ISH_I2C2A_SCL, THC_I2C[0:1]_SCL, THC_I2C[0:1]_SDA.

I2C Fast Mode (400 kHz)

Frequency: 400 kHz

I2C Fast Mode (400 kHz) Settings
Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down Strength
Up to 50 pF3.9 kΩ100 Ω
45 pF to 100 pF2.7 kΩ100 Ω
85 pF to 250 pF1.2 kΩ50 Ω

I2S

I2S General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Host/ device mode terminologyHost Mode refers to the mode where the clock is driven by Intel PCH. Device Mode refers to the mode where the clock is driven by external device.

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Device Down) Topology

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Diagram
I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R115 Ω ± 5% Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from CPU, but can be extended to 50.8 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum.
R227 Ω ± 5%. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from device.
Max frequency12.288 MHz
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 10 ns. Data input hold time < 10 ns. 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 30 ns.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Trace spacing between port to port0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D (I2S0): 50 Ω. [2] GPP_S (I2S1/ I2S2): 50 Ω, slew 11.
Signal name/ listI2S[0:2]_SCLK, I2S[0:2]_SFRM, I2S[0:2]_TXD, I2S[0:2]_RXD.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx7Total Channel
Tx7Total Channel
Rx7Total Channel

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
R1Resistor23
M1Trace34
DEVICEDevice4-1

Signal Group: Rx

Signal MRTS

BOTrace12

Segment Lengths

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BODSL, MS, SL12.7
M1DSL, MS, SL368.3
M2DSL, MS, SL355.6
M3MS, DSL, SL12.7

Min Length Total (mm): 50.8

Min Length Total Note: Tx: BO + M1= 50.8 mm, Rx: BO + M2 + M3 = 50.8 mm.

Max Length Total (mm): 381

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
I2S Signal Ganging with CNVi GPIO Topology Diagram
I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R115 Ω ± 5%. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from CPU, but can be extended to 50.8 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum.
R227 Ω ± 5%. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from connector/ header.
R3 (applicable to I2S to discrete CNV module topology only)1k Ω. Used for ganging I2S signals with CNVi GPIO signals. Required on the CNVi GPIO signals, to be placed <2" from the ganging point.
Additional guidelines for I2S to discrete CNV module topology[1] For I2S topology connecting to discrete connectivity module, there is a requirement to share/ gang I2S signals with CNVi GPIO signals (RF_RESET_B and CLKREQ) onto the same physical line: - I2S_SFRM with RF_RESET_B - I2S_TXD with CLKREQ [2] A 1k Ω resistor (R3) is required on the CNVi GPIO signals, to be placed <2" from the ganging point. [3] Location of the ganging is not restricted and can be implemented anywhere along the bus. [4] Refer to "I2S signal ganging with CNVi GPIO" diagram for guidance on the implementation. Note that the I2S series resistors (R1 and R2) are still needed and considered in a separate topology diagram.
Max frequency12.288 MHz
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 10 ns. Data input hold time < 10 ns. 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 30 ns.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Trace spacing between port to port0.375 mm
CPU buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D (I2S0): 50 Ω. [2] GPP_S (I2S1/ I2S2): 50 Ω, slew 11.
Signal name/ listI2S[0:2]_SCLK, I2S[0:2]_SFRM, I2S[0:2]_TXD, I2S[0:2]_RXD.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx7Total Channel
Tx7Total Channel
Rx7Total Channel

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
R1Resistor23
M1Trace34
ConnectorDevice4-1

M3DSL, MS, SL25.4
M4MS, DSL, SL12.7
M5MS, DSL, SLDenotes length of the ganging CNVI GPIO signal for I2S discrete connectivity topology. There is no max length restriction for this segment.

Min Length Total (mm): 50.8

R233 Ω ± 5%. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from the connector/ header.
Max frequency12.288 MHz
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).

I3C

I3C 1-Island (Device Down) Topology

I3C 1-Island (Device Down) Topology Diagram
I3C 1-Island (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Mixed bus topologyThis topology supports usages with a mix of I2C and I3C devices. For mixed I2C and I3C bus, routing should follow I3C PDG.
Reduced max lengthActual max length for I3C can go up to 1016 mm. Reduced max length is due to legacy I2C Fast Mode Plus (FM+) requirement.
Island terminology'Island' refers to 1 to 3 devices connected and placed near to each other, where the max capacitance per island is 20 pF. For multiple devices within an island, the max stub length to each device is 25.4mm.
Max frequency2 MHz
Rpu1 kΩ.
R120 Ω. Placed within 25.4 mm distance from CPU
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Max device buffer driver strength90 Ω.
CPU buffer driver strength40 Ω.
Signal name/ listI3C[0:3]_SDA, I3C[0:3]_SCL, I3C[0:1]A_SDA, I3C[0:1]A_SCL, I3C3A_SDA, I3C3A_SCL, ISH_I3C[0:1]_SDA, ISH_I3C[0:1]_SCL, I3C1B_SDA, I3C1B_SCL.

Signal Group: Rx-Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
R1Resistor23
R1Resistor24
RpuResistor45
1p8VRail5-1
M1Trace36
IslandDevice6-1

Max frequency10 MHz
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).

I3C 2-Island Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology

I3C 2-Island Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology Diagram
I3C 2-Island Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Mixed bus topologyThis topology supports usages with a mix of I2C and I3C devices. For mixed I2C and I3C bus, the routing needs to follow the I3C PDG.
Reduced max lengthActual max length for I3C can go up to 762 mm. Reduced max length is due to legacy I2C Fast Mode Plus (FM+) requirement.
Island terminology‘Island’ refers to 1 to 3 devices connected and placed near to each other, where the max capacitance per island is 20 pF. For multiple devices within an island, the max stub length to each device is 25.4mm.
Max frequency2 MHz
Rpu1 kΩ.
R120 Ω. Placed within 25.4 mm distance to CPU.
R220 Ω. Placed within 25.4 mm distance to device.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Max device buffer driver strength90 Ω.
CPU buffer driver strength40 Ω.
Signal name/ listI3C[0:3]_SDA, I3C[0:3]_SCL, I3C[0:1]A_SDA, I3C[0:1]A_SCL, I3C3A_SDA, I3C3A_SCL, ISH_I3C[0:1]_SDA, ISH_I3C[0:1]_SCL, I3C1B_SDA, I3C1B_SCL.

[2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. RTC

RTC (Real Time Clock) Topology

32.768 kHz RTC Crystal Topology Diagram
RTC (Real Time Clock) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Length matching between RTC_X1 and RTC_X2Total length mismatch: 1.27 mm
GND shieldingGND shielding to adjacent signals (especially high speed IO) is recommended.
Number of vias allowedMax 2 vias - recommended to minimize number of vias.
Reference planeContinuous GND only; do not reference to power planes. If routed as stripline or dual stripline, both top and bottom reference/ adjacent planes MUST be solid continuous ground.
External capacitor valuesExternal capacitors C1 and C2 must be matched (C1 = C2). Capacitor values should be tuned according to load capacitance of RTC Crystal. If the crystal load capacitance reduces ( per data sheet information), C1/C2 value should be reduced as well. For example if load capacitance is close to 10pF, more optimized C1/C2 value would be closer to 10 pF (instead of 14 pF). Due to vendor variation in crystal characteristics, layout variation and PCB trace, calculation is recommended to determine C1/C2 Values.
Main route (MR)Main route (MR) is recommended to be limited to SL/ DSL to limit coupling and impact from EMI/ RFI sources.

Segment Lengths

RTC (Real Time Clock) Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BOMS, SL12.7
MRSL

Max Length Total (mm): 20.3

Max Length Total Note: Max length of 20.3 mm is based on 0402 resistor and capacitor sizes assumption. Max length can be 25.4 mm if component sizes are reduced from 0402 to 0201.

SMLink

SMLink General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Note 1Multiple options for pull-up/ pull-down and current assist strengths are provided for a particular total bus capacitance. Choose the optimal value for system based on design considerations like power, BOM and cost.
Note 2Trace capacitance per inch is approximately CL = 85√єr / Zo pF, єr - dielectric constant of material, Zo - trace impedance.
Note 3Bus capacitance calculation assumptions: [1] Device capacitance = 5 pF to 10 pF per SMBus 2.0/ SMLink device. [2] Motherboard board trace capacitance = 2 pF to 5 pF per inch of trace length. [3] CPU pin capacitance = 8 pF to 10 pF.

SMLink Topology

SMLink Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Stackup layer (microstrip/ stripline/ dual stripline)MS/ SL/ DSL.
Characteristic impedance30 Ω to 70 Ω.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Trace spacing between CLK and other signals [1] 0.375 mm: Frequency of other signals > 1 GHz. [2] 0.250 mm: Frequency of other signals > 100 MHz. [3] 0.125 mm: Frequency of other signals ≤ 100 MHz.
Trace spacing between DATA and other signals0.125 mm
Trace segment lengthRefer to bus capacitance table.
Total trace length (DATA, CLK)Individual trace lengths should meet total bus capacitance (Cb) requirements for the mode of operation. Refer to the pull-up/ pull-down tables for the supported bus capacitance.
Length matching between DATA and CLK signals25.4 mm
Pull-up resistor placementNo restriction.
Pull-up resistor value tolerance± 5%
Max stub length to pull-up resistor25.4 mm
Board trace characteristic assumptions for default pull-up recommendationBoard trace resistance per length = 20 Ω per meter. Board trace capacitance per length = 208 pF per meter.
Extended length supportFor extended length support, refer to "xxxxxx_NVL-Hx_I2C_SMLINK_LSIO_Flexi_PDG". Potential enablers: [1] Reduced trace resistance. [2] Reduced trace capacitance. [3] Optimized pull-up resistor placement.
Signal name/ listSML[0:1]CLK, SML[0:1]DATA, SML[0:1]ALERT#, SML0BCLK, SML0BDATA, SML0BALERT#, PSE_SMLCLK, PSE_SMLDATA, PSE_SMLALERT#, USBC-SMLCLK, USBC-SMLDATA.

Frequency: 400 kHz

Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down Strength
Up to 50 pF1.8 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 100 pF1.5 kΩ100 Ω
75pF to 200 pF560 Ω100 Ω
85 pF to 300 pF430 Ω50 Ω

Frequency: 1 MHz

SMLink Fast Mode Plus (1 MHz) Settings
Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down Strength
Up to 50 pF820 Ω100 Ω
Up to 100 pF470 Ω100 Ω
Up to 200 pF270 Ω50 Ω

SoundWire

Description: SoundWire

SoundWire Large System: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

SoundWire Large System: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
SoundWire Large System: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
M_Cable characteristic impedance target50 Ω ± 10%.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency12.288 MHz
SoundWire ports supportedSingle-lane: Port #0, Port #1, Port #2, Port #3. Multi-lane: Port #2 (up to 3 data lane), Port #3 (up to 4 data lane).
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals5.08 mm
CPU TX & RX timing register configurationFor total length < 600 mm: [1] CLDS = 5 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 7 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 9 Clock Period For total length ≥ 600 mm: [1] CLDS = 6 Clock Period [2] DODS/DODSE/DODSE2 = 7 Clock Period [3] DOAIS/DOAISE/DOAISE2 = 9 Clock Period Please refer to "Intel Smart Sound Technology ACPI Configuration" for further details on how to configure timing register. (BIOS Specification Doc#:  609917)
CPU buffer driver strength50 Ω, slew 11.
Device buffer driver strength & resistor combination1) Device buffer driver strength of 20 Ω ± 30% 2) Device series resistor of 56 Ω ± 5% Refer to section on "Additional Guidelines - SoundWire* Interface Design Guidelines" for resistor placement to achieve the recommended device drive impedance target.
Signal name/ listSNDW[0:3]_CLK, SNDW[0:3]_DATA.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias Allowed
Rx, Tx4

Signal Group: Rx-Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
M2Trace34
CONNDevice4-1

SoundWire Large System: 2-Load Dumbbell Topology
